programme.title: Posh Pawn
programme.desc: An Ibiza club DJ plans to take her act beyond the shores of the party island, but needs funds to push herself into the global limelight, and hopes the sale of her designer goods will give her the money she needs to achieve her ambition. Enter handbag specialist Claudia, James Constantinou's fiancee, who offers the customer a big surprise. Meanwhile, Alicja gets excited when she claps eyes on a vintage gold and diamond timepiece, and Prestige boss James hopes to recoup his losses when an unredeemed Aston Martin goes to auction.(n)

programme.title: Sun, Sea and Selling Houses
programme.desc: Southport estate agent Gill and her friend Sue look round properties in Alicante, while in Almeria, Chris and Carol are also looking to make a permanent move to the sun.(n)

programme.title: Phil Spencer: Secret Agent
programme.desc: The property expert helps a man try to sell his terraced house in Bolton and gives owner Danny some advice about the amount of attention his home needs if it is ever going to be sold.(n)

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: Anthony Wedo, President and CEO of Buffets, Inc, goes undercover to find out what his staff members are really like. He was brought on to the team to turn the firm around after years of challenges and poses as a construction worker to find out the flaws in the business.(n)

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: Travis Boersma, co-founder and president of one of the largest privately owned drive-through coffee shop chains in America, goes undercover to learn whether the culture he and his brother hoped to implement is being upheld by the company's front-line employees.(n)

programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Three couples compete in East Sussex. The food includes burgers followed by jelly, and a traditional Ghanaian menu, leaving the third pair confident they have it in the bag.(n)

programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: The cooking contest moves to Lincolnshire, with former soldier Scott and partner Clare kicking off the week, followed by Su and Dylan, and ending with ex-army couple Adele and Dave.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: The chef revisits two restaurants, Giuseppi's and Sante La Brea, to find out whether the owners took his advice on how to raise standards. Plus, an update on Finn McCool's.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: The owners of Jack's Waterfront at St Clair Shores in Michigan are keen to hear the fiery chef's advice for turning their failing seafood restaurant around. The lakeside location is a popular summer spot with fantastic views, but an uninspiring menu and a manager more skilled at socialising than organising are preventing them from achieving year-round success.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Home or Away
programme.desc: Laura Hamilton and Jasmine Harman help recently widowed Jan decide whether to spend her £100,000 budget on a house near to her sister in Kent, or a renovation project to keep her busy in Abruzzo, Italy.(n)

programme.title: UK's Best Place to Live
programme.desc: Sarah Beeny reveals the United Kingdom's most desirable place to live. With the help of analysis of key factors, she travels around the UK looking for good affordable housing, best job prospects, reasonable child care, quality of family life and of social life. At the end of the show she reveals which location scores best.(n)

programme.title: The Secret Life of the Zoo
programme.desc: Elderly one-eyed South African porcupine Roxy is introduced to a new, younger male called Henning, in the hope that she will find companionship in her old age. Kifaru, the oldest eastern black rhino at Chester Zoo, meets younger female Malindi, with the expectation that they will produce offspring to increase the dwindling population, while the Caribbean flamingos are breeding again.(n)

programme.title: The Royal House of Windsor
programme.desc: The final episode of the series focuses on the most outspoken heir to the throne, Prince Charles, and the radically different vision of the monarchy he promised for his own reign. From a young age, Charles was determined to do something important with his position in the royal family, doing so as he set up the Prince's Trust charity to help unfashionable causes, and also weighed in on controversial political issues across the years.(n)

programme.title: 999: What's Your Emergency
programme.desc: The documentary looks at how disputes and fights between neighbours are on the increase. Crewe officers Billy Elliot and Greg Greaves help a man who claims someone else has moved into his flat while he was on holiday, while in Warrington, PC Jon Tetlow investigates reports of a man frightening children. A background check reveals numerous reports of problems between the man and his neighbours, so police have to act quickly before locals take matters into their own hands.(n)

programme.title: How'd You Get So Rich
programme.desc: Katherine Ryan continues to hang out with a selection of the richest people in the world, including two men who made their millions from selling sex toys, a woman who creates luxury creams from bee venom and a man who designs the most exclusive cars on the planet.(n)

programme.title: First Dates
programme.desc: Fairy-tale fan Kathleen still hasn't met her Prince Charming, but at first glance, international fashion model Sam doesn't disappoint. Historical re-enactor Rory meets Aussie cross-stitcher Maddie, and woos her with his knowledge of Viking beards, while animal lover Steph is paired with fireman Rich. Will she be impressed with his stories of saving cats from burning buildings?.(n)

programme.title: Mutiny
programme.desc: The crew load up their barrels and kit bags for the last time and set off in the blistering heat of northern Australia to make the 1,200-mile voyage to Timor. The final leg of the journey isn't plain sailing and when the winds slow so too does their progress, leaving them facing their most desperate challenge yet - life-threatening dehydration. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Flashy Funerals
programme.desc: Documentary exploring some of the UK's most extraordinary final goodbyes, meeting families who go above and beyond to ensure their loved ones go out in style. With access to some of Britain's leading funeral directors, the programme explores the challenges they face as they organise some of the biggest funerals of their careers, pulling out all the stops, with just one chance to get it right.(n)

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown
programme.desc: Jimmy Carr hosts the popular quiz with guest captain Claudia Winkleman and Johnny Vegas going up against Jon Richardson and Reginald D Hunter. Sara Pascoe joins resident lexicographer Susie Dent in Dictionary Corner, while Rachel Riley looks after the numbers and letters.(n)

programme.title: Vet on the Hill
programme.desc: New series. Scott Miller operates on a cat that has a fused jaw and is unable to eat properly, while haircut turns into a consultation for the barber's dog.(n)

programme.title: Travel Man
programme.desc: Richard Ayoade heads to the Canary Islands for a packed mini-break with actress and writer Lena Dunham, the star and creator of American comedy drama Girls. In the north of the island, Richard and Lena visit a guachinche pop-up restaurant, where they have goat stew before exploring the barren lunar-like landscape around the volcanic Mount Teide and spend the evening stargazing. There is also a sculpture tour, including works by Henry Moore and Joan Miro, as well as layered coffee, a spot of golf and a search for whales.(n)

programme.title: Posh Pawn
programme.desc: Managing director James heads to Lanzarote to tackle his biggest deal yet - the sale of a £1.5million yellow submarine. A jeweller to the stars wants to pawn her collection to expand her business, while Lawrence appraises a guitar with links to punk band the Sex Pistols owned by a former millionaire who's now living in a bedsit. A doting father-to-be decides to get rid of his pride-and-joy black Ferrari to buy a family home.(n)

programme.title: Sun, Sea and Selling Houses
programme.desc: Special needs teacher Kerry Smith seeks a holiday home in southern Spain, but her limited budget forces her to consider properties more inland than she would have wished.(n)

programme.title: Phil Spencer: Secret Agent
programme.desc: The property expert discovers a clutter problem in Ben and Kate's Grade II-listed cottage in Shoreham-by-Sea, West Sussex, which is still languishing on the market despite 15 viewings by potential buyers. In nearby Worthing, he presents busy single mother Zoe with a long list of changes required before her home can compete on the housing market.(n)

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: Amit Kleinberger, the CEO and co-owner of frozen yoghurt chain Menchie's, poses as a participant in a reality TV contest to find out whether consistency is being maintained in his stores. The company has experienced rapid growth and Amit tries to establish what changes must be made to become a billion-dollar business.(n)

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: Eric Casaburi, a former undercover boss, invites six other employers who also appeared incognito on the show to talk about their experiences of the programme at a restaurant. However, little do they realise that Eric is going to try to fool them by appearing as a waiter. Featuring Kat Cole, Paul Damico, Andy Wiederhorn, Sheldon Yellen, Anthony Wedo and Jane Grote Abell.(n)

programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Glasgow pair Jean and Ron hope their `taste of Scotland' menu will impress their guests. Day two sees Colin and Craig try to claw back the limelight and jolly up the mood.(n)

programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Three East Sussex couples compete for the £1,000 prize, including one pair who divide up the cooking and the hosting, and another duo who cannot seem to stop bickering.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: The chef heads to family-owned Italian restaurant Giuseppi's in Macomb Township, Michigan. Father and son Joe and Sam Borgia's constant fighting is driving customers away, and Gordon discovers one of the restaurateurs is concealing a serious health problem. Nevertheless, he sets about rescuing them from disaster and turning around the failing business.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay comes to the aid of a restaurant in Mount Sinai, New York, which appears to be stuck in the 1980s. The crumbling decor and unenthusiastic head chef at the Handlebar need to be tackled, but owners Bill and Carolyn LeRoy are in denial about the problems they face.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Home or Away
programme.desc: A range of properties in Bournemouth, Dorset, and Sicily provide food for thought for the owners of a B&B in northern France, who are ready for a slower pace of life in a different country.(n)

programme.title: Great British Buildings: Restoration of the Year
programme.desc: The Victorian category comes into focus as Kevin McCloud and Anna Keay present more building restorations in the running for the Royal Institution of Chartered Surveyors' Restoration of the Year award. Anna explores Mount Stewart, an imposing country house in Northern Ireland, and Wilton's Music Hall in east London. Architectural historian Jonathan Foyle visits the Pump House in Barry, Wales, and historic building surveyor Marianne Suhr looks round a medieval-style castle in Stornoway in the Scottish Highlands. At the end of the programme, it is revealed which buildings have been chosen to make the final shortlist.(n)

programme.title: The Royal House of Windsor

However, while his first wife Suzie takes the challenges of plural marriage in her stride, his second wife Beth is struggling with Marina's demands on their husband's attention - and things come to a head on the day of the birth.(n)

Elsewhere, agents Gary Brown and Cona Jackson are involved in a serious altercation with a young man who owes almost £11,000, who threatens the officers with a knife when they start listing goods to seize to offset the debt.(n)

programme.title: Can't Pay? We'll Take It Away
programme.desc: Paul and Ben face a challenging eviction in London, where a vulnerable tenant in rent arrears has barricaded her front door, and the agents receive a tirade of abuse. Meanwhile, Brian and Del chase a debt of nearly £2,000 in Surrey, before trying to recover almost £3,000 in Northamptonshire. Finally, Steve and Ru head to Portsmouth to evict a young family for a landlord who wants her property back.(n)

programme.title: Parker
programme.desc: A thief is betrayed and left for dead by his partners in crime. He learns they are planning a diamond heist in a wealthy neighbourhood, so poses as a millionaire wanting to buy a house in the area. A real-estate agent sees through the disguise and helps him get even by stealing the gems from his traitorous gang. Action thriller, with Jason Statham and Jennifer Lopez.(n)

programme.title: Leatherheads
programme.desc: In 1925, an enterprising pro football player convinces America's too-good-to-be-true college football hero to play for his team and keep the league from going under(n)

programme.title: Mr. Deeds
programme.desc: When Preston Blake, a remarkably wealthy media magnate, dies with neither a wife nor children, the question on the lips of most of his associates is who will inherit the estate. The surprising answer turns out to be Longfellow Deeds (Adam Sandler), a cheerful but half-bright proprietor of a small-town pizzeria, as well as part-time greeting card poet, who was a distant relative of Blake(n)

programme.title: The Doctor
programme.desc: Jack McKee is a doctor with it all: he's successful, he's rich, and he has no problems.... until he is diagnosed with throat cancer. Now that he has seen medicine, hospitals, and doctors from a patient's perspective, he realises that there is more to being a doctor than surgery and prescriptions(n)

programme.title: Frequency
programme.desc: In this well-acted fantasy about changing history, James Caviezel plays a grieving cop who hears the voice of his dead father (Dennis Quaid) while experimenting with a ham-radio set. Together, they try to stop the events that led to the man's death. Andre Braugher(n)

programme.title: Head of State
programme.desc: Can a high-attitude African-American politician who says what he thinks stand a chance in a presidential campaign? Mays Gilliam (Chris Rock) is a straight-talking alderman representing a inner-city neighborhood in Washington, D.C. In the midst of a hard-fought race for the White House, the Democratic presidential and vice-presidential candidates are killed in an airline crash, and with little time to prepare a new campaign, the Republican candidate, Vice President Brian Lewis (Nick Searcy), seems all but guaranteed to win. With practically nothing to loose, party head Martin Geller (Dylan Baker) approaches Gilliam and asks him to stand as the Democrat's presidential candidate. While Gilliam is dubious at first, before long his streetwise style and willingness to face the issues head-on earns him surprising figures in the polls, especially after he persuades his short-fused older brother, Mitch Gilliam (Bernie Mac), to join the ticket as vice presidential candidate -- a big jump for a bail bondsman. Gilliam's love life also becomes more complicated as his ex-girlfriend Kim (Robin Givens) decides she wants him back now that he has a shot at the White House, even though Gilliam only has eyes for Lisa (Tamala Jones). Head of State marked the directorial debut for comic and actor Chris Rock, who also co-wrote and co-produced the film(n)

programme.title: Renaissance Man
programme.desc: An out-of-work exec reluctantly takes a job teaching English to a group of underachieving Army recruits to help them complete basic training. He bonds with them by introducing them to Shakespeare, and clashes with an unimpressed Drill Sergeant(n)

programme.title: Criminal Activities
programme.desc: In this suspenseful thriller, four friends get in over their heads when they become indebted to a dangerous crime boss. Now, they must kidnap a beloved member of a rival kingpin's family in order to erase their debt, and do so without getting caught or killed in the process(n)

programme.title: Scarface
programme.desc: A Cuban immigrant becomes a cocaine kingpin in this update on the gangland classic(n)

programme.title: Insomnia
programme.desc: A sleep-deprived detective plays an intense cat-and-mouse game with a sly murderer in a remote Alaska town. A remake of the 1997 Norwegian film of the same name(n)

programme.title: Gone in 60 Seconds
programme.desc: Randall "Memphis" Raines, a retired car thief, is drawn back into action when a crime lord threatens to whack Raines' brother unless the thief steals 50 top-model cars within 72 hours. Raines recruits a crew of fellow carjackers, including an old pro and an old flame, and the race is on(n)

programme.title: National Treasure
programme.desc: Action drama in which a treasure hunter (Nicholas Cage) finds the map to a secret war chest hidden by America's Founding Fathers. He is close to discovering its whereabouts, but so is his colleague-turned-enemy, and the FBI are also on the case(n)

programme.title: Definitely, Maybe
programme.desc: Romantic comedy directed by Adam Brooks. Ryan Reynolds plays Will Hayes, an advertising executive whose marriage is on the cusp of ending in divorce. But before it does, his 10-year-old daughter Maya asks her father to explain how he met her mother. Instead of giving her a straight answer, Reynolds recounts his relationships with three women over the previous 16 years, changing their names and then inviting Maya to guess which woman he married. So, did Reynolds fall for his college sweetheart Emily; the kooky apolitical friend April he met while working on the Bill Clinton campaign in 1992; or is she the ambitious, carefree journalist Summer?(n)

programme.title: Jem and the Holograms
programme.desc: A small-town teen's singing video goes viral and catapults her and her sister's band into global super stardom, but their newfound fame threatens to break apart their familial bonds in this spirited adapted musical fantasy(n)

programme.title: Captain Ron
programme.desc: After he inherits a yacht, Chicago businessman Martin totes his family to the Caribbean to claim it. Not having any skill at boating, he hires long-haired, one-eyed low-life Captain Ron, to pilot the heap to Miami. During the journey, the somewhat inept sailor frequently loses his way while becoming a hit with everyone in the family--except Martin(n)

programme.title: Corrina, Corrina
programme.desc: Jessie Nelson's romantic drama, which she also wrote and produced, stars Ray Liotta as Manny Singer, a widower whose young daughter Molly has become almost catatonically withdrawn following her mother's death. Realising he needs help, Manny advertises for a housekeeper and selects Corrina Washington since Molly reacted positively to her. As Corrina draws Molly out of her shell, so Manny falls in love with her, but in 50s America, inter-racial relationships are still frowned on and the pair face prejudice from all sides as their relationship blossoms(n)

programme.title: Sea of Love
programme.desc: A detective looking for a killer meets a seductive woman, who turns out to be a possible suspect in this romantically charged crime drama(n)

programme.title: Ghost World
programme.desc: Two highschool friends,Enid and Rebecca, on the verge of leaving their adolescence behind, try to decide what to do with their lives.Enid discovers a kindred spirit in fellow misfit Seymour, who shares her disgust with the world around them(n)

programme.title: Dark Water
programme.desc: Dahlia and daughter Ceci are happy in their New York apartment until stagnant water begins to seep through the roof. Is someone - or something - living upstairs? Psychological horror from the author of The Ring(n)

programme.title: Hostage

programme.title: NCIS

Ducky conducts an autopsy and makes a discovery that sets the agents off in search of a missing infant. Meanwhile, Tony is distracted by developments in his relationship with Jeanne.(n)

Crime drama, starring Christopher Meloni and Mariska Hargitay.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit

Meanwhile, Langston receives a job offer as Grissom prepares to leave Las Vegas.(n)

However, the only way to find out whether one of Crista's suitors is a killer is for Laura to sign up to the same service herself, and under Billy's watchful eye, she prepares for what could turn out to be a deadly date. programme.title: Good Burger
programme.desc: Kenan Thompson and Kel Mitchell, stars of the popular Nickelodeon series All That, confront the ogre of faceless corporate tyranny and have fun doing it in this comedy for young people. Ed (Mitchell) is a teenager who lives for his job at Good Burger, a small but friendly neighborhood hamburger stand, while his buddy Dexter (Thompson) also works there, but lack Ed's single-minded devotion to his job -- he's there because he accidentally destroyed the car of his teacher Mr. Wheat (Sinbad) and has to raise money to pay the damages. When Mondo Burger, a mammoth fast-foot chain, opens across the street, it looks like Good Burger is history, until Ed formulates a secret sauce that brings hundreds of new customers to their door. However, the monomaniacal manager of Mondo Burger, Kurt (Jan Schweiterman), is determined to get his hands on the sauce and put Good Burger out of business. Meanwhile, Ed and Dexter must rescue Otis (Abe Vigoda), the world's oldest fast food employee, from the Demented Hills Asylum, and Ed might just find love with Monique (Shar Jackson) if he could take his mind off the burgers long enough to pay attention to her. Good Burger also features basketball star Shaquille O'Neal as himself and George Clinton as one of the Demented Hills inmates(n)

programme.title: The Amityville Horror
programme.desc: One of the most celebrated horror films of the late '70s is given a new look in this remake, produced by blockbuster filmmaker Michael Bay. George and Kathy Lutz (Ryan Reynolds and Melissa George) are a young couple who are looking for a new home, and think they've found a dream house in Amityville, Long Island -- a large and beautiful home available at a bargain price. George thinks that there must be a catch, and learns that the house has a dark history -- a year before, a man living in the house murdered his family in their sleep, claiming he was commanded to commit the crime by demons. Shrugging off stories that the house is haunted, George and Kathy move in with their three kids, only to discover that something evil lurks within the house, and even Father McNamara (Philip Baker Hall), an expert on possession, is powerless to clear the dark spirits from the home. The Amityville Horror was based on the same book by Jay Anson that provided the basis for the 1979 film, which in turn documented an actual incident(n)

programme.title: Animals in Love
programme.desc: Mating for Life. Liz Bonnin explores the complex and diverse relationships that animals have and asks whether animals love. For centuries it was thought that animals did not share the same emotions as us but new science is starting to change that view. She starts by travelling to the Democratic Republic of the Congo to meet some bonobos who seem to have found the secret of long-lasting successful relationships. From wild dogs in Africa to tamarins in the UK, Liz continues her journey to find out what it takes to have a successful relationship in the animal kingdom. In Switzerland Liz learns about Tariq, a goose who, when faced with a choice, stuck firmly to his mate. She also meets Dotty and Zee, a pair of penguins who defied expectation when after ten years together as a devoted couple, it was discovered that things were not quite as they seemed. Finally, in search of an answer to her question, Liz meets a Siamang gibbon called Sam and hears how he dealt with the death of his life partner(n)

programme.desc: Daniel tries to help a family plagued by secrets, while a face from the past turns up on Ayesha's doorstep. Karen's interest is piqued by Mrs Tembe's good mood.(n)

programme.title: The Code
programme.desc: Matt Allwright asks the questions as work colleagues Julien, Kristian and Matt try to crack the three-digit code that will open a safe full of money.(n)

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Jules Hudson helps a couple with a budget of £450,000 look for their first home together, complete with business potential, in North Yorkshire. Plus, he learns about the art of ploughing from a six nations champion.(n)

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: A team at the Bristol Upholstery Collective get to work on an old three-piece suite, while woodworking duo Josh and Oli try to make something of an old oak beam.(n)

programme.title: Flog It
programme.desc: Paul Martin, Will Axon and Charles Hanson are at Althorp in Northamptonshire, where items include advertising memorabilia that had been buried and a 19th-century silver sewing kit.(n)

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz show in which pairs of contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions posed to 100 people before the show. At the end of each round, the team with the most points is eliminated until the final two pairs battle for the chance to compete for a cash prize. Presented by Alexander Armstrong and Richard Osman.(n)

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Matt Baker and Angela Scanlon present the live magazine show featuring a mixture of celebrity chat and stories of interest.(n)

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: The aftermath of earlier events sends shockwaves across the Square, and there are further bombshells when an unexpected incident turns the lives of one Walford family upside down.(n)

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: Another eight hopefuls are given just 80 minutes to invent and cook one dish from the ingredients available in the MasterChef market. On offer today are poussin, lamb rack and duck breast as well as mussels, prawns and crab. The stakes are high in this opening round as three of the cooks will be sent home, while the remaining five have one more challenge standing between them and a quarter-final place. They have to cook a menu that will impress not just John Torode and Gregg Wallace, but also the 2015 finalists - Emma Spitzer, Tony Rodd and champion Simon Wood.(n)

programme.title: Galapagos
programme.desc: Liz Bonnin joins a research expedition across the Galapagos Islands, the vast archipelago where evolution has proceeded at an extraordinary pace. The journey begins on the west side, home to a richly diverse wildlife scene, where Liz and the scientists journey into the clouds above the islands' tallest volcano on a hunt for the endangered pink iguana. Liz also travels to one of the most remote locations in the Galapagos in search of giant tortoises, and boards a submersible to dive for a new species.(n)

programme.title: Question Time
programme.desc: David Dimbleby chairs the debate from Carlisle, with a panel of politicians and other guests facing topical questions from the audience.(n)

programme.title: This Week
programme.desc: Andrew Neil introduces a round-table chat, in which he, Michael Portillo and other guests take a light-hearted romp through the latest political and parliamentary developments.(n)

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: Round-up of national and international news, plus the latest from the money markets.(n)

programme.title: Holding Back the Years
programme.desc: Bill Turnbull visits Edinburgh to expose some of the fake news concerning health in old age, touching on themes such as pioneering experiments and new NHS treatment options. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Lucy Alexander, Dion Dublin and Martin Roberts explore a flat conversion in Glasgow, a purpose-built flat in Stoke-on-Trent and a large pub in Hastings, East Sussex.(n)

programme.title: Fugitives
programme.desc: Metropolitan Police officers try to identify a suspect accused of killing a man and shooting a policeman in Brazil, back in November 1994. A Welshman who became a multi-million pound drug smuggler is arrested in South Africa. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Fake Britain
programme.desc: Matt Allwright meets a man who almost lost everything when his dream job turned out to be part of a complex fraud. Plus, a look at the counterfeit computer hard drives that can cost consumers data as well as money, and the truth about fake hairdryers.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Natasha Raskin presents from the Quayside Antiques centre in Topsham, near Exeter, as Danny Sebastian and Gary Pe assist two teams picking up items to sell at auction.(n)

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc: Ayesha tries to get to the bottom of her visitor's troubles, while Mrs Tembe finds it hard to confide in Ruhma about her new relationship. Elsewhere, a restaurant is petrol bombed.(n)

programme.title: The Code
programme.desc: Matt Allwright hosts the quiz, inviting three close friends from Stratford-upon-Avon to answer questions in order to crack a three-digit code that will open a safe full of money.(n)

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Jules Hudson helps a couple of retirees with £700,000 to spend on their dream home. She also tries her hand at the country art of thatching.(n)

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Sarah Moore enlists the help of Mark Haig to turn a Second World War field telephone into something functional again. She also brings an Edwardian single bed into the 21st century.(n)

programme.title: Flog It
programme.desc: The programme revisits some of the locations from the series, including Greenwich Royal Naval College, Althorp House in Northamptonshire, and Herstmonceux Castle, East Sussex.(n)

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz show in which pairs of contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions posed to 100 people before the show. At the end of each round, the team with the most points is eliminated until the final two pairs battle for the chance to compete for a cash prize. Presented by Alexander Armstrong and Richard Osman.(n)

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Angela Scanlon hosts the final edition of the week, featuring the usual mix of celebrity guests and stories about people in extraordinary circumstances.(n)

programme.title: Inside Out London
programme.desc: Gareth Furby meets activists protesting against Heathrow's third runway and Mark Jordan finds out how virtual reality is helping hospice patients. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: As the Albert Square residents continue to reel from recent events, family and friends try to pull together. But it remains to be seen who will stand by their loved ones, and whether the past can be forgotten quite so easily.(n)

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: Journalist and broadcaster Amol Rajan sets the brief as John Torode and Gregg Wallace introduce the first quarter-final, from which the best contestants go through to Knockout Week. His challenge for the amateur cooks is to make an exceptional dish, choosing from one of two briefs he has given them. The contestants must either cook a savoury dish using Indian spices or a chocolate dessert with a playful twist. After cooking their dish, the candidates must stand before Amol, John and Gregg and hear what they think of their dish and how well they have adhered to the brief.(n)

programme.title: Decline and Fall
programme.desc: New series. Jack Whitehall, David Suchet, Eva Longoria, Tim Pigott-Smith and Douglas Hodge lead an all-star cast in James Wood's adaptation of Evelyn Waugh's comic novel. Oxford University divinity student Paul Pennyfeather is wrongly dismissed for indecent exposure, having been made the victim of a prank. He seeks employment at an obscure public school in Wales, where he encounters the glamorous mother of one of the pupils. For Paul it is love at first sight, but little does he know the surprises that lie ahead of him when he agrees to tutor her son over the summer holidays.(n)

programme.title: Pirates of the Caribbean: On Stranger Tides
programme.desc: Captain Jack Sparrow sets sail in search of the legendary fountain of youth. His mission puts him up against a mysterious woman from his past, old enemy Barbossa, now in the employ of the British Navy, and the most feared pirate of them all, the dreaded Blackbeard. Fantasy adventure sequel, with Johnny Depp, Penelope Cruz, Geoffrey Rush and Ian McShane.(n)

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.(n)

programme.title: Fugitives
programme.desc: Police hunt down a dangerous robber on the run in the Netherlands, and officers in London try to extradite a convicted Turkish man refusing to leave his home.(n)

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: The team transform items reclaimed from a skip in Walsall in the West Midlands, featuring a leather chair, metal shoe lasts and four kitchen chairs.(n)

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don mulches the borders in preparation for spring and pots up his dahlias for the year ahead. Carol Klein celebrates her plant of the month, which can only mean the bright and beautiful daffodil. Frances Tophill heads to Barbados to offer her services to Andromeda Botanic Gardens and using the opportunity to brush up on her horticultural skills. And as part of the programmes 50th anniversary, Nick Bailey reveals the plant he thinks has had the most impact on British gardens over the last half-century. Includes a gardeners weather forecast.(n)

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.sub-title: Great British Railway Journeys Goes to Ireland: Navan to Mullingar.
programme.desc: Michael Portillo continues his journey across Ireland, travelling from Navan to Mullingar. Along the way, he gets up to speed with modern archaeology in County Meath, where he uncovers a controversial Victorian dig at the sacred Hill of Tara. Later, he investigates leaping salmon in Leixslip, and in Mullingar, bangs the drum for the town's traditional marching band.(n)

programme.title: Victoria Derbyshire
programme.desc: Daily news and current-affairs programme offering discussion of breaking stories, exclusive interviews and audience interaction via social media.(n)

programme.title: BBC Newsroom Live
programme.desc: A chance to stay up to date on the day's leading stories, with the latest breaking news as it happens.(n)

programme.title: Daily Politics
programme.desc: Parliamentary proceedings interspersed with discussions, interviews and filmed reports from around the country. Presented by Andrew Neil and Jo Coburn.(n)

programme.title: Two Tribes
programme.desc: Richard Osman presents the quickfire quiz in which the seven contestants are split into teams according to what they have in common with one another, based on their responses to questions about themselves. There follows a series of general knowledge rounds in which one contestant is eliminated each time, ending with two players going head to head for a cash prize.(n)

programme.title: Holiday of My Lifetime with Len Goodman
programme.desc: Strictly Come Dancing head judge Len Goodman takes actress Lisa Riley - best known to Emmerdale fans as Mandy Dingle on a journey to Bronte Country - Haworth in West Yorkshire - to re-create a family trip there in 1992. The pair travel in a Citroen CX, just like the one Lisa's mum drove all those years ago, and after the obligatory Barbra Streisand singalong, Lisa explains the importance of the Bronte sisters on her childhood. Along the way, Len and Lisa take a trip on a steam trip, visit the Bronte memorial chapel and chat about the actress's career.(n)

programme.title: The TV That Made Me
programme.desc: Brian Conley invites broadcaster Penny Smith to choose the TV programmes that have shaped her life, including children's saga The Singing Ringing Tree.(n)

programme.title: Who Do You Think You Are
programme.desc: John Bishop was once a pharmaceuticals sales director, but changed career to become a stand-up comedian. As he traces his family tree, he is surprised to discover he is not the only one in his family to have ended up on the stage - although what his great-great-grandfather Charles Bishop did gives him something to think about. He also explores what happened to his other great-great-grandfather, who spent time as a prisoner of war in Crimea.(n)

programme.title: More Creatures Great and Small
programme.desc: Megan helps to rehome 80 caged hens with local families in Fife, and when one is discovered with a broken leg, she decides to take care of it. In Teesdale, farm vet Richard takes drastic action to save the life of a calf with bloat, while Helen meets a Jack Russell puppy that has bitten its own tongue. Narrated by Felicity Kendal.(n)

programme.title: Life Story
programme.desc: The importance of power in the animal kingdom, revealing how dominant creatures have the best access to food and water, and are also the most attractive to the opposite sex. An orphaned young chimp tries to climb the social ladder, but his troop is ruled by big, aggressive males and his first attempt to join them ends in a beating. A meerkat society will only allow newcomers in if they know how to deal with a venomous snake. And the only way to occupy the top spot in a meadow of kangaroos is to beat the ruling male in a boxing match - but few have challenged the current incumbent, who stands at 8ft. Will any animal dare take him on? David Attenborough narrates.(n)

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Philip Serrell and Anita Manning embark on the penultimate leg of their challenge in the Northumberland village of Amble, before heading to auction in Carlisle, Cumbria.(n)

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Jeremy Vine hosts the quiz in which the winners of famous game shows work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize.(n)

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: A firefighting historian restores an antique helmet, a Victorian garden gnome is returned to its original condition and a treasured musical box is mended before the owner finds out.(n)

programme.title: Great Continental Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo braves the freezing temperatures of the Baltic Sea and finds peace paddling a canoe on the Lakes of Finland. On his journey from the Latvian capital Riga to Tampere in Finland, he encounters medieval knights in Tallinn, grills sausages in Helsinki and samples cloudberry liqueur in a hot tub. He later arrives in Estonia, where in the setting of a ruined 13th-century cathedral he learns how the Baltic countries demonstrated their desire for independence from the Soviet Union with a `singing revolution'.(n)

programme.title: Stargazing Live
programme.desc: Brian Cox and comedian Dara O Briain present their final report from the Warrumbungle National Park in Australia, as they conclude their mission to view the most glorious sights of the southern night sky. With the help of astronomer Greg Quicke, they discover how the apparently monochrome night sky is anything but. They also reveal how Australia is on the frontline when it comes to protecting the planet, and Liz Bonnin reports on how the Australian Outback contains secrets that Nasa hopes will lead it to alien life on Mars. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: The Last Kingdom
programme.desc: Uhtred and Halig have been condemned to a life of slavery and are forced to row endlessly on a trader ship, while Guthred welcomes Aelfric and the savage Dane brothers Erik and Sigefrid into Eoferwic as a reward for dispatching his enemy. But when their agreement is jeopardised, Guthred offers Gisela as a peace offering. Will she comply? Meanwhile, Alfred, Ragnar and Brida are instructed to rescue Uhtred and set off in search of the slave ship - but with conditions at sea worsening, they may not be able to rescue him in time.(n)

programme.title: MOTD: The Premier League Show
programme.desc: Gabby Logan presents the magazine programme featuring news and action from the Premier League, plus interviews with the country's biggest football stars.(n)

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events, presented by Evan Davis.(n)

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Chris Harris and Matt LeBlanc compete in a race across the Arabian peninsula, pitting a Bugatti Chiron against an assortment of other ways of travelling - with money no object. Rory Reid creates a life-size arcade game to put city cars to the test, and Tinie Tempah takes a ride on the Top Gear track in a Toyota GT86.(n)

programme.title: Top Gear: Extra Gear
programme.desc: Chris Harris, Rory Reid and George Lewis take a look at the new Bugatti Chiron, try out a life-size arcade game, and put a Bentley Mulsanne Speed through its paces.(n)

programme.title: The Greatest Tomb On Earth: Secrets of Ancient China
programme.desc: Dan Snow, Alice Roberts and Albert Lin explore the final resting place of China's first emperor, a site 200 times larger than Egypt's Valley of the Kings and home to the famous Terracotta Warriors. Making use of both the latest forensic technology and ancient texts, they delve into this historic site's secrets and uncover evidence that casts a new light on the founding of the nation.(n)

programme.title: Britain on the Fiddle
programme.desc: An undercover operation is set up to catch out a single mother who says she works for low pay in a betting shop, has been claiming housing benefit in several London boroughs and yet has enough money to fund a wardrobe of designer clothes. An investigator in Staffordshire checks out lifetime disability awards given to a local angling champion, and a woman who claims she has no grip and poor eyesight but is working as a school bus driver. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.(n)

programme.title: Fugitives
programme.desc: A dawn raid in London leads to the arrest of an elusive Portuguese woman wanted for embezzlement. West Yorkshire police track a teenager's attacker all the way to Slovakia.(n)

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: A team at the Bristol Upholstery Collective get to work on an old three-piece suite, while woodworking duo Josh and Oli try to make something of an old oak beam.(n)

programme.title: Back to the Land with Kate Humble
programme.desc: The presenter is in South Devon to meet cider-makers who are trying to reverse the trend of apple orchard decline as they plough a six figure sum into a new orchard on their land. She also follows a farming family who have tapped into the trend for the UK's answer to olive oil, and discovers a young lad with no farming background who is running a modern business with traditional Devon sheep breeds. Plus, entrepreneur Geetie Singh-Watson finds how online shopping is bringing our markets closer together and enabling an edible flower grower to thrive.(n)

programme.title: Victoria Derbyshire
programme.desc: Daily news and current-affairs programme offering discussion of breaking stories, exclusive interviews and audience interaction via social media.(n)

programme.title: BBC Newsroom Live
programme.desc: A chance to stay up to date on the day's leading stories, with the latest breaking news as it happens.(n)

programme.title: Daily Politics
programme.desc: Parliamentary proceedings interspersed with discussions, interviews and filmed reports from around the country, presented by Andrew Neil.(n)

programme.title: Two Tribes
programme.desc: Richard Osman presents the quickfire quiz in which the seven contestants are split into teams according to what they have in common with one another, based on their responses to questions about themselves. There follows a series of general knowledge rounds in which one contestant is eliminated each time, ending with two players going head to head for a cash prize.(n)

programme.title: Holiday of My Lifetime with Len Goodman
programme.desc: Former Strictly Come Dancing judge Len Goodman takes ex-footballer and TV presenter Dion Dublin on a journey to Great Yarmouth to recreate a seaside holiday from 1979. The pair travel in a 1970s Morris Marina Coupe, get competitive in a football match, play a game of air hockey in the arcade, and compete in Segway racing.(n)

programme.title: The TV That Made Me
programme.desc: Swimmer Rebecca Adlington joins comedy entertainer Brian Conley for a nostalgic look at the archive television programmes that helped set her on the path to Olympic success. Her selections include Fawlty Towers, Blind Date and Art Attack.(n)

programme.title: Who Do You Think You Are
programme.desc: Bafta-winning actress Julie Walters, of Educating Rita, Mamma Mia! and Harry Potter fame, traces her roots back to Co Mayo in western Ireland, where her great-grandfather Anthony Clark was one of the first members of the Land League. The organisation was formed in 1879 and campaigned for more than 40 years for the rights of tenant farmers to own their own land.(n)

programme.title: More Creatures Great and Small
programme.desc: Vet Steve helps a kestrel with a damaged wing get back into the wild, while equine specialist Sybil treats a pony with a locked leg - and a reputation for misbehaviour. At the Small Animal Hospital in Fife, heart and lung expert Craig is under pressure as he attempts to save a Yorkshire terrier's life. Narrated by Felicity Kendal.(n)

programme.title: Life Story
programme.desc: David Attenborough reveals how the competition to breed creates scenes of the most extraordinary beauty, as well as some of the most violent battles seen in nature. A male flame bowerbird shows off its artistic prowess to impress a potential mate - but if that does not prove enough, it will demonstrate its dancing skills instead. Waved albatrosses pair up for life and spend hours in each other's company, although things are not so simple for a male peacock jumping spider - one wrong move in its dazzling courtship routine could prove fatal. However, one of the most magnificent displays of all is created by a tiny male pufferfish, which impresses the ladies by building a spectacular underwater `crop circle' in the sand - arguably the most perfect and complex structure created by any animal.(n)

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Antiques experts Anita Manning and Philip Serrell kick off their final leg in Castle Douglas, Kirkcudbrightshire, and finish at a nail-biting final auction in Crooklands in the Lake District.(n)

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Jeremy Vine hosts the quiz in which the winners of famous game shows work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize.(n)

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: Ceramicist Kirsten Ramsey works on putting a shattered vase by Jean Lurcat, a contemporary of Picasso's, back together again. An Italian chair and a jewellery box are also restored.(n)

programme.title: Great Continental Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo concludes his journey in the Netherlands, where he travels from Rotterdam to Utrecht, including a visit to the world's largest flower auction in Haarlem, a trip to Delft to learn how the city came to specialise in pottery and an exploration of the government buildings in The Hague.(n)

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don begins a brand new project when he starts a new soft fruit garden, and also plants new potatoes and divides herbaceous plants in the jewel garden. Frances Tophill visits an extraordinary tropical garden in Barbados developed from a collapsed cave, while the programme also catches up with exponent of gardening for wildlife Chris Baines, in his own small town garden. Plus, as part of the series' 50th anniversary, Mark Lane nominates the plant he thinks has had the most impact on British gardens over the last half century. Including weather.(n)

programme.title: Only Connect
programme.desc: Victoria Coren Mitchell hosts the second semi-final, in which two teams of contenders use patience, lateral thinking and sheer inspiration to make connections between groups of four things that may appear at first not to be linked, with one set of clues consisting of Pudding and Cheese, Maria and Peter, Widow and Murder, and Ops and Funk.(n)

programme.title: The House That £100K Built
programme.desc: Kieran Long and Piers Taylor follow the fortunes of Jody and Lori, who are desperate for a modern family home and have decided to gamble everything they have on building a new one from scratch. Kieran takes the couple to see a series of homes tailor-made for the people that live in them. Each is packed with ideas they could try. As the build gathers pace, Lori struggles to make colour choices, so Piers explains the basics of colour theory, but will they really move from safe whites and greys to bold oranges and blues? Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Panellists Phill Jupitus, Josh Widdicombe, Sara Pascoe and Alan Davies compete, as Stephen Fry goes looking for monsters. As usual, the host poses questions that are so difficult, points are awarded for the answers he finds most interesting.(n)

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events, presented by Kirsty Wark.(n)

programme.title: Robot Wars
programme.desc: Dara O Briain and Angela Scanlon present the next stage of the contest, with robots Supernova, Frostbite, Wyrm, High 5, Crushtacean, Ironside 3, Pulsar and Apex battling it out through a series of nine face-offs. Professor Noel Sharkey, Dr Lucy Rogers and Professor Sethu Vijayakumar judge the outcomes, while Jonathan Pearce provides running commentary on the action.(n)

programme.title: 100 Days
programme.desc: BBC News teams in Washington DC and London report on the events that are shaping the world.(n)

programme.title: Top of the Pops: 1983
programme.desc: Richard Skinner and Tommy Vance present music from June 30, featuring Shalamar, Nick Heyward, Irene Cara, Paul Young, Tom Robinson, Bucks Fizz and Rod Stewart.(n)

programme.title: Henry VIII: Patron or Plunderer
programme.desc: Part two of two. Historian Jonathan Foyle explores how the king's choices in art and architecture provide clues to his mental state in the 1530s. Following the monarch's break from Rome, divorce from Catherine of Aragon and subsequent marriage to Anne Boleyn in the hope of finally fathering an heir, his desperation for a new image was at its peak.(n)

programme.title: The Golden Age of Steam Railways
programme.desc: Part two of two. The story of the visionaries who helped to rescue Britain's standard gauge railways continues, as further home-shot footage reveals how these volunteers managed to restore the lines that once served the nation's mines, quarries, factories and docks, but fell into disuse from the 1950s onwards. Narrated by Jenny Agutter.(n)

programme.title: Flying Scotsman - Sounds From the Footplate
programme.desc: A guide to life on the footplate of the nation's favourite steam engine. Cameras are placed aboad locomotive 60103 as it travels along the Severn Valley, cutting through stunning landscapes on a journey from Bridgnorth to Kidderminster. The `cab cameras' capture veteran driver Roger Norfolk and fireman Ryan Green in action as they talk through the mechanics and challenges of operating this national treasure. Needless to say, things sometimes get hot on the footplate and not everything goes exactly to plan.(n)

programme.title: Natural World
programme.desc: Documentary capturing the beauty of butterflies close up, and revealing how they inspire the images of street artist Nick Walker and the performances of burlesque dancer Vicky Butterfly. The programme also raises the question of whether a passion for these elegant insects could help people preserve much-loved landscapes. Narrated by Imelda Staunton.(n)

programme.title: Britain's Outlaws: Highwaymen, Pirates and Rogues
programme.desc: Sam Willis concludes his exploration of the criminal underworld of the 17th and 18th centuries by looking at urban crime, fraud and corruption, uncovering a fascinating rogues' gallery of villains. He examines the case of thief and serial escaper Jack Sheppard, who was so notorious that almost a quarter of a million people turned up to witness his hanging, while fraudster Mary Toft managed to convince George I's surgeon that she had given birth to rabbits. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Top of the Pops: 1983
programme.desc: Richard Skinner and Tommy Vance present music from June 30, featuring Shalamar, Nick Heyward, Irene Cara, Paul Young, Tom Robinson, Bucks Fizz and Rod Stewart.(n)

programme.title: Storyville
programme.sub-title: Storyville: From the Sea to the Land Beyond - Britain's Coast on Film.
programme.desc: Documentary exploring the role of Britain's coastline in people's lives, from holidays at the seaside to wartime. Penny Woolcock's film blends archive clips with a soundtrack created by Brighton band British Sea Power.(n)

programme.title: Henry VIII: Patron or Plunderer
programme.desc: Part two of two. Historian Jonathan Foyle explores how the king's choices in art and architecture provide clues to his mental state in the 1530s. Following the monarch's break from Rome, divorce from Catherine of Aragon and subsequent marriage to Anne Boleyn in the hope of finally fathering an heir, his desperation for a new image was at its peak.(n)

programme.title: World News Today
programme.desc: The day's leading stories.(n)

programme.title: Top of the Pops: 1983
programme.desc: John Peel and David Jensen introduce performances from 7 July by Roman Holliday, Mary Jane Girls, Freeez, the Cure, Funk Masters, and Jimmy the Hoover.(n)

programme.title: BBC Young Dancer 2017
programme.desc: Anita Rani hosts this contest showcasing the very best British dance talent aged between 16 and 21. This edition focuses on the ballet category, featuring contenders Ryan Felix, Jade Wallace, Rhys Antoni Yeomans, Uyu Hiromoto and Oscar Ward. Judging them are former principal dancer with the Royal Ballet Deborah Bull, former artistic director of English National Ballet Matz Skoog and choreographer and founder of the dance company that bears her name Shobana Jeyasingh. The other categories are dance music, contemporary and South Asian, and the contest culminates in a grand final to be staged at Sadler's Wells.(n)

programme.title: Big Hits: TOTP 1964 to 1975
programme.desc: A selection of performances from the first years of Top of the Pops, featuring the Rolling Stones, Peter Sarstedt, Tom Jones, Stevie Wonder, Julie Driscoll, Queen, the Kinks, Procol Harum, Stealers Wheel, the Seekers and Status Quo.(n)

programme.title: Top of the Pops: 1977
programme.sub-title: Top of the Pops 1977: Big Hits.
programme.desc: A selection of highlights from the pop show's 1977 editions, including performances by Rod Stewart, the Jacksons, Queen, the Stranglers, Brotherhood of Man, David Bowie, Bob Marley, Baccara, Heatwave and Elvis Costello.(n)

programme.title: Top of the Pops: 1978
programme.sub-title: Top of the Pops: The Story of 1978.
programme.desc: Documentary about the change of musical direction in 1978, when pop singles were slowly ousted by disco, punk and new wave artists. The programme features contributions by members of the Boomtown Rats, Squeeze, Boney M and Sham 69 - among others - and archive performances by the likes of Elvis Costello, the Undertones, Ian Dury and the Blockheads and the Jam.(n)

programme.title: Bowls
programme.desc: The best women's bowlers from England and Scotland go head-to-head in triples, pairs and singles matches over a best of 11 format in York. 8/10.(n)

programme.title: Rugby Tonight
programme.desc: BT Sport's panel of experts are joined by guests and a live studio audience to discuss all things rugby and look ahead to the upcoming domestic, European and international action.(n)

programme.title: Toyota AFL Highlights Show
programme.desc: The best of the latest action from the opening round of the Australian Football League, featuring in-depth analysis and exclusive behind-the-scenes access.(n)

programme.title: Live AFL

programme.title: Mean Girls
programme.desc: Lindsay Lohan stars as Cady Heron who, having been home-schooled by her parents, is new to high school and totally unversed on how to survive the jungle-like teen society. But, befriended by two other outsiders, goth Janis and gay Damian, she infiltrates queen bee Regina George's hive to bring about her downfall. Mark (Freaky Friday) Waters' teen comedy is a cut above the rest, thanks to a smart screenplay from Saturday Night Live regular Tina Fey (based on Rosalind Wiseman's non-fiction survival guide for young girls, Queen Bees and Wannabees ) and outstanding performances not just from Lohan, but the whole cast (watch out for Tim Meadows as the scene-stealing Principal Duvall)(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: An explosion at a mausoleum exposes a number of freshly dismembered bodies, prompting the team to launch a multiple murder investigation to identify the victims. Meanwhile, Abby has a personal problem to deal with - and it seems Gibbs is the only person she will confide in. Drama, starring Pauley Perrette and Mark Harmon.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A supposedly dead marine suddenly regains consciousness on the autopsy table, leaving the team struggling to solve the mystery of how he came to be in such a strange predicament. Investigations reveal he had recently been on a trip to Baghdad - and uncover an unexpected link to Gibbs' past. Drama, starring Mark Harmon.(n)

programme.title: Diagnosis Murder
programme.desc: A valued member of staff at the hospital is suspected of killing a vindictive media magnate who was receiving treatment. Drama, starring Dick Van Dyke and Scott Baio.(n)

programme.title: Gunsmoke
programme.desc: Part two of two. Matt helps a lost boy find his mother, then resumes his pursuit of the outlaw. Ellen Burstyn guest stars.(n)

programme.title: Bonanza
programme.desc: When a former actress kills her ex-boyfriend, Hoss takes the blame. The deceased is the son of a senator, who vows to take down the Cartwrights as revenge for the death.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Part two of two. Agent Callen poses as an arms trade contact in a bid to catch killer Michael Aaron Rivkin. Meanwhile, Tony fears Ziva may not be loyal to the team, and a psychologist uncovers the truth about the relationship between Gibbs and Agent Macy. With Chris O'Donnell, Louise Lombard and LL Cool J.(n)

programme.title: NCIS: Los Angeles
programme.desc: A man who stole a car and ran down and killed one of his pursuers before escaping is identified as Walton Flynn, an ex-marine now working for a private security firm in Iraq. Sam and Callen learn that the businessman he had been hired to protect had been murdered and that the people chasing him were hired by his employers to dish out their own form of justice. Crime drama, starring Chris O'Donnell and LL Cool J.(n)

programme.title: Mission: Impossible
programme.desc: In a bid to gather evidence against a deadly organisation, Cinnamon hatches a plan that could have terrible consequences for Jim.(n)

programme.title: JAG
programme.desc: Mac and Harm travel to Saudi Arabia to defend a female pilot who disobeyed the country's traditional dress laws. David James Elliott stars.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Gibbs and his team investigate the bizarre deaths of a marine and two of his friends at a stag party. Elsewhere, Gibbs tries to persuade Vance to allow Ziva back into the NCIS. However, she must first pass a barrage of psychological evaluations. Mark Harmon, David McCallum, Michael Weatherly and Pauley Perrette star.(n)

programme.title: Diagnosis Murder
programme.desc: Steve asks the FBI to protect Mark from bereaved syndicate members who blame him for the death of an organised-crime kingpin. Drama, starring Dick Van Dyke, Scott Baio and Barry Van Dyke.(n)

programme.title: Walker, Texas Ranger
programme.desc: Walker gets trapped down a drain hole when he attempts to rescue a young boy. Adventure with the modern-day lawman whose crime-solving methods are rooted firmly in the Old West. Chuck Norris stars.(n)

programme.title: NCIS: Los Angeles
programme.desc: A jet-skier crashes on to the shore and is discovered to be dead, having been shot through the chest. At HQ, Hetty shows the team surveillance footage of the shooting and identifies the victim as Daniel Su, an engineer who defected from North Korea and was working for the US government on a highly classified research project. Sam and Callen visit the victim's apartment, where they find the body of a woman on the floor.(n)

programme.title: The King of Queens
programme.desc: Carrie and Doug volunteer to take care of Kelly and Deacon's son Kirby, but end up red-faced when he catches them in a compromising position. Comedy, starring Kevin James and Leah Remini.(n)

programme.title: The King of Queens
programme.desc: Arthur decides to work part-time in the senior citizens programme run by Carrie's company, while Doug and Deacon compete to see who can play the best practical joke. Comedy, starring Jerry Stiller, Kevin James and Leah Remini.(n)

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: Debra and Ray grow irritated by Robert and Amy's over-the-top displays of affection - especially when the pair start giving them relationship advice. Ray Romano and Patricia Heaton star.(n)

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: Gianni is hired to do some work on the kitchen, but infuriates Debra with his laziness. Comedy, starring Ray Romano, Jon Manfrellotti and Patricia Heaton.(n)

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: Niles and Frasier agree to eat at Martin's favourite restaurant, but are not prepared for its laid-back atmosphere. Comedy, starring Kelsey Grammer, David Hyde Pierce and John Mahoney.(n)

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: A journalist devotes a newspaper column to criticising Frasier, who responds in kind, triggering off a full-scale feud between the pair. Comedy, starring Kelsey Grammer.(n)

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: Eric Casaburi, a former undercover boss, invites six other employers who also appeared incognito on the show to talk about their experiences of the programme at a restaurant. However, little do they realise that Eric is going to try to fool them by appearing as a waiter. Featuring Kat Cole, Paul Damico, Andy Wiederhorn, Sheldon Yellen, Anthony Wedo and Jane Grote Abell.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: The owners of Jack's Waterfront at St Clair Shores in Michigan are keen to hear the fiery chef's advice for turning their failing seafood restaurant around. The lakeside location is a popular summer spot with fantastic views, but an uninspiring menu and a manager more skilled at socialising than organising are preventing them from achieving year-round success.(n)

programme.title: Channel 4 News Summary
programme.desc: Includes news headlines, sport and weather.(n)

programme.title: Vet on the Hill
programme.desc: New series. Scott Miller operates on a cat that has a fused jaw and is unable to eat properly, while haircut turns into a consultation for the barber's dog.(n)

programme.title: Posh Pawn
programme.desc: High-end pawnbroker James hopes to sell a Second World War Tiger Moth biplane for £70,000, while two different diamond rings bought for £22,000 give the Prestige Pawnbrokers team a headache. Plus, a lord and lady try to sell some luxury handbags and a guitar signed by members of the Rolling Stones.(n)

programme.title: Countdown
programme.desc: Nick Hewer and Rachel Riley present the words-and-numbers game, with ITV news presenter Nina Hossain in Dictionary Corner with Susie Dent.(n)

programme.title: Fifteen to One
programme.desc: Sandi Toksvig hosts the general knowledge quiz in which 15 contestants try to win a place in the final, when a £40,000 jackpot will be up for grabs.(n)

programme.title: Sun, Sea and Selling Houses
programme.desc: Sailing enthusiasts Andy and Dee look for a large holiday home in Spain, while a woman's insistence on bringing her pet parrot is complicating her property search in Alicante.(n)

programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Three East Sussex couples compete for the £1,000 prize, including one pair who divide up the cooking and the hosting, and another duo who cannot seem to stop bickering.(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.sub-title: When You Dish Upon a Star.
programme.desc: Homer befriends holidaying Hollywood stars and promises to keep their whereabouts a secret - but cannot resist telling the gang at Moe's about his new celebrity friends. With the guest voices of Kim Basinger, Alec Baldwin and Ron Howard.(n)

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: Drama following the lives and loves of a group of teenagers and young adults in Chester.(n)

programme.title: Channel 4 News
programme.desc: Including sport and weather.(n)

programme.title: Great British Buildings: Restoration of the Year
programme.desc: The Victorian category comes into focus as Kevin McCloud and Anna Keay present more building restorations in the running for the Royal Institution of Chartered Surveyors' Restoration of the Year award. Anna explores Mount Stewart, an imposing country house in Northern Ireland, and Wilton's Music Hall in east London. Architectural historian Jonathan Foyle visits the Pump House in Barry, Wales, and historic building surveyor Marianne Suhr looks round a medieval-style castle in Stornoway in the Scottish Highlands. At the end of the programme, it is revealed which buildings have been chosen to make the final shortlist.(n)

programme.title: Three Wives, One Husband
programme.desc: Abel Morrison has three wives and 11 children, and his newest wife, Marina, is heavily pregnant, so it's a chaotic time for the family. However, while his first wife Suzie takes the challenges of plural marriage in her stride, his second wife Beth is struggling with Marina's demands on their husband's attention - and things come to a head on the day of the birth.(n)

programme.title: Eyewitness
programme.desc: Two 15-year-old boys meets up to explore their attraction for each other, only to be interrupted by the arrival of a car - and shortly after, the hidden teenagers witness a shocking, violent crime. Fearing for their lives, they vow to keep the incident between themselves, disposing of evidence in the hope of covering their tracks. In Norwegian with English subtitles. The rest of the series can be seen on All 4.(n)

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Long-distance lorry driver Neil, 52, has fallen backwards off a ramp onto a concrete floor and is sent for an urgent CT scan, the results of which are a shock. Also receiving treatments are 29-year-old Ben, who has dislocated his shoulder in a cycling accident, and Wendy, 73, who is in resus with a severe open ankle fracture after falling at home.(n)

programme.title: Flashy Funerals
programme.desc: Documentary exploring some of the UK's most extraordinary final goodbyes, meeting families who go above and beyond to ensure their loved ones go out in style. With access to some of Britain's leading funeral directors, the programme explores the challenges they face as they organise some of the biggest funerals of their careers, pulling out all the stops, with just one chance to get it right.(n)

programme.title: The World's Most Expensive Food
programme.desc: The conclusion of the documentary following the companies who cater to Britain's super-rich clients examines how competition for the attention of the mega-wealthy is driving innovation. Suppliers must deliver more than just food as their customers have already eaten in all the best restaurants, meaning it's the exclusivity of the dining experience that counts and the story behind the ingredients that matters.(n)

programme.title: Bare Knuckle Fight Club
programme.desc: Documentary uncovering the hidden and shocking underground world of bare knuckle fighting, where men from all walks of life compete against each other in bloody battles. The man at the heart of the Fight Club is Shaun Smith, who is being monitored by police as he plans put on the biggest bare knuckle fight ever seen in the UK.(n)

programme.title: Dispatches
programme.desc: Antony Barnett investigates the multinational beverage corporation, which one of the world's most recognised brands.(n)

programme.title: Unreported World
programme.desc: Marcel Theroux explores the resurgent Russian Orthodox Church, which is at the forefront of a new movement combining religion and nationalism in its home nation. Until the fall of the Soviet Union, the Church had been persecuted by the communists, but has now forged close ties with President Vladimir Putin. Theroux meets Alexander Dugin, referred to as `Putin's brain', whose ideas have cropped up in the president's speeches, and Fr Ioann Osyak, patriarch of a family whose members are becoming national celebrities and symbols of today's Russia - religious, conservative and deeply patriotic.(n)

programme.title: Phil Spencer: Secret Agent
programme.desc: The property expert helps Colin Brunold sell his four-bedroom house in Grappenhall, Warrington, which has been on the market for five months. He discovers a chimney problem may be putting off potential buyers, along with some dodgy decor.(n)

programme.title: Fifteen to One
programme.desc: Sandi Toksvig hosts the general knowledge quiz in which 15 contestants try to win a place in the end-of-series final, when a £40,000 jackpot will be up for grabs.(n)

programme.title: Countdown
programme.desc: Nick Hewer and Rachel Riley present the words-and-numbers game, with ITV news presenter Nina Hossain in Dictionary Corner with Susie Dent.(n)

programme.title: The King of Queens
programme.desc: Doug buys Carrie a camera, but her boss presents her with a more expensive one. To make matters worse, she gives the cheaper model to Kelly - showing up Deacon in the process. Lou Ferrigno and Ricki Lake guest star.(n)

programme.title: The King of Queens
programme.desc: Doug and Carrie are invited to a wedding, but have second thoughts about going when they discover how long the journey to the venue will be. Arthur asks Spence to help him with his new money-making scheme.(n)

programme.title: The King of Queens
programme.desc: Doug hatches a plan to watch a forthcoming Super Bowl game on the high-definition television owned by Carrie's boss. Lou Ferrigno and Ricki Lake guest star.(n)

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: Amy invites her brother for dinner, but he ends up outstaying his welcome, forcing Robert to take desperate measures to eject him from the couch. Comedy, starring Ray Romano.(n)

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: Ray and Debra begin telling lies in a bid to cover up previous falsehoods, but Marie soon suspects what they are doing. American comedy, starring Ray Romano, Patricia Heaton and Doris Roberts.(n)

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: Martin begins spying on a neighbour through his new telescope and eventually strikes up an acquaintance, much to the delight of Frasier, who does his best to encourage their relationship. Comedy, starring Kelsey Grammer and John Mahoney.(n)

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: Horrified to learn he has unwittingly invested in a forged painting, Frasier considers his options - and decides to exact a suitable revenge on the dealers who sold it to him. Kelsey Grammer stars.(n)

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: Shane Evans, COO and co-founder of massage therapy chain Massage Heights, poses as a contestant on a TV reality show who is trying fund her own business. After spending nine years moulding the company, she decides to find out first-hand how her retreats are doing so she can fix potential problems before expanding the business to 300 new locations.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay comes to the aid of a restaurant in Mount Sinai, New York, which appears to be stuck in the 1980s. The crumbling decor and unenthusiastic head chef at the Handlebar need to be tackled, but owners Bill and Carolyn LeRoy are in denial about the problems they face.(n)

programme.desc: Includes news headlines, sport and weather.(n)

programme.title: Vet on the Hill
programme.desc: Scott Miller treats a dog that has developed a painful limp, while a Labrador with three legs is developing another worrying mass and a pet hedgehog needs to be put on a diet.(n)

programme.title: Posh Pawn
programme.desc: High-end pawnshop boss James test drives a home-made electric bike, while the Prestige Pawnbrokers team are put to the test when a £30,000 diamond ring arrives with the wrong paperwork. programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Edinburgh lovebirds Andy and Pim hope to impress guests Jimmy and Jas and Stuart and Jack, with a Scottish and Thai-themed menu, with a bit of American thrown in for good measure.(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Homer discovers his long-lost mother was a free-spirited hippie and decides to follow in her footsteps, throwing off the shackles of conformity and becoming a drop-out dedicated to the pursuit of peace and free love.(n)
