The duo's mysterious client presents them with a list of three targets, but as they go about their deadly work, they start to realise there is something far more disturbing going on than a simple act of murder. Thriller, with Neil Maskell, Michael Smiley and MyAnna Buring.(n)

programme.title: Anna Olson: Fresh
programme.desc: Anna prepares a meal for her husband and shares her recipe for meatloaf with buttermilk mashed potatoes, warm sausage and pepper salad and an apple tart with salted caramel sauce.(n)

programme.title: Anna Olson: Bake
programme.desc: The presenter demonstrates how to make a classic Brioche - slightly sweet, buttery, making it perfect for breakfast or brunch.(n)

programme.desc: The team is tasked with making a Harry Potter cake for a film premiere, as well as a fish-shaped creation complete with an angling tackle box.(n)

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree Drummond tours a local kitchen store while gathering some favourite tools for a wedding gift. As she gathers the goodies, she shares the great dishes she'll make with each.(n)

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: It's fires on the ranch and flames in the kitchen as Ree Drummond prepares dinner for the family, including several grilled favourites in a mouth-watering feast.(n)

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree Drummond demonstrates how to make a tex-mex themed celebration lunch, including recipes for chipotle chicken chili, chili cheese muffins, caramel brownies and Mexican punch.(n)

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree Drummond demonstrates how to make croissant French toast with maple whipped cream, grilled chicken and strawberry salad wrap, and pawhuska cheese-steaks.(n)

programme.title: Paul Hollywood: City Bakes
programme.desc: The baker and celebrity chef travels to Madrid, where he finds traditional choux pastry treats filled with a sweet cream at a bakery set up to supply the Spanish royal family.(n)

programme.title: Paul Hollywood: City Bakes
programme.desc: Paul visits the Polish city of Warsaw, where he creates a new take on the Polish babka, a sponge flavoured with citrus, honey and coconut.(n)

programme.title: Chinese Food in Minutes
programme.desc: Two nurses visit London's Chinatown with Ching-He Huang to explore the wide variety of rice available on the market. Later, she teaches them to prepare a Taiwanese chicken and rice dish, along with ginger, chilli and soy-steamed cod with special egg-fried rice, before challenging them to reproduce the recipes she has demonstrated.(n)

programme.title: Chinese Food in Minutes
programme.desc: A pair of professional ice-skaters investigate hot varieties of store cupboard spices at London's Chinatown, before Ching-He Huang teaches them how to prepare peppercorn chicken, prawn-fried rice and crispy scallops.(n)

programme.title: Jamie at Home
programme.desc: Chef Jamie Oliver joins a partridge shoot, finding out from a gamekeeper how to get involved with the countryside. He then rustles up dishes using fresh game birds and recipes inspired by Asian, European and traditional British cuisine, designed to get the best flavour possible.(n)

programme.title: Jamie at Home
programme.desc: The chef looks for things to do with pumpkins other than turning them into traditional Halloween lanterns. Recipes include a roast duck and pumpkin winter salad with Asian dressing, a soup and a lighter snack - squash fairy cakes.(n)

programme.title: Jamie's Ministry of Food
programme.desc: Crusading chef Jamie Oliver sets out to help people make the most of their meagre pantries, inspired by the efforts of the wartime Ministry of Food. In Rotherham, Jamie meets a `Burger Mum' who once fed her children takeaways through the railings of their school's playground, and tries to teach a fast-food loving population the joys of preparing their own meals.(n)

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree Drummond's doing some cowgirl catering as she pitches in with the family, bringing them a delicious breakfast and then serving up a fabulous lunch.(n)

programme.title: Spring Baking Championship

programme.title: Jamie's Ministry of Food

programme.title: Jamie at Home
programme.desc: The chef serves up home-grown winter salad dishes, including a bagna cauda, a herb omelette, and a Japanese-style tuna sashimi with sprouting herb salad and a surprising dressing. programme.title: Spring Baking Championship
programme.desc: In this episode, the bakers take on a special treat by transforming coffee and cream into a delectable dessert. Then they must whip up a festive mum-worthy brunch.(n)

programme.title: Jamie's Ministry of Food
programme.desc: With his campaign slowly failing to revolutionise the diets of Rotherham residents, Jamie Oliver seeks advice from wartime cooking guru Marguerite Patton, who was once a part of the original Ministry of Food. He also witnesses the shocking measures the NHS has taken to deal with the country's obesity problem, and attempts to teach a recipe to 1,000 pupils in just one day.(n)

programme.title: Jamie at Home
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver prepares recipes using leeks, including pappardelle and a `concertina' squid dish. He also explains why the underrated vegetables can be a real asset in the kitchen and offers advice on how to grow and store them.(n)

programme.title: Jamie at Home
programme.desc: The chef serves simple recipes using winter vegetables grown in his Essex garden. He prepares a seasonal coleslaw and bubble and squeak, and uses homegrown cabbage to make an Italian soup.(n)

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives

programme.desc: Guy visits Southern-inspired Brooklyn, New York, to sample fried chicken and waffles, a spicy pulled pork sandwich and a daily doughnut.(n)

programme.title: Jamie and Jimmy's Friday Night Feast
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver and Jimmy Doherty present dishes for the weekend from their cafe on Southend Pier, joined by celebrity guests in the kitchen. The duo also tour Britain to promote some of the nation's best regional foods, from Lancashire's Tosset cake to Colchester pudding. programme.title: Cheers
programme.desc: Woody is gripped by gambling fever, and tension mounts in the bar as Carla waits for a second anniversary gift from her husband.(n)

programme.title: Cheers
programme.desc: Sam grows tired of wooing Rebecca and decides to switch his amorous attentions to her sister instead - but ends up with a dead body on his hands. Ted Danson and Kirstie Alley star.(n)

programme.title: The Best of Tommy Cooper
programme.desc: Comedy highlights, courtesy of the frantic funnyman with the fez, featuring his unique style of magical illusion.(n)

programme.title: My Hero
programme.desc: George is initially bewildered by preparations for Christmas, but soon decides to join in the festive fun by dressing up as Santa and creeping into the houses of Janet's parents and her boss's to leave them presents. Unfortunately, his plan backfires disastrously. Festive edition of the superhero comedy from 2000, starring Ardal O'Hanlon.(n)

programme.title: My Hero
programme.desc: Thermoman reveals his double identity to Janet's parents, but her mother can't keep a secret and her father is determined to interest him in model railways and cardigans. Comedy, starring Ardal O'Hanlon and Emily Joyce.(n)

programme.title: Sorry
programme.desc: Timothy ends up in hospital following an incident at the tennis court.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Nora Batty invites Compo up to her bedroom, but it proves to be an entirely innocent invitation as she merely wishes him to remove a mangle and deliver it to a friend. However, the nature of the item creates all sorts of problems. Long-running comedy, starring Bill Owen and Kathy Staff.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Seymour departs for a new teaching job, leaving Clegg and Compo at a loose end now he is no longer around to drag them into his eccentric schemes. However, they do not realise an old friend is about to return to the village. Comedy, starring Peter Sallis, Bill Owen and Brian Wilde.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Foggy makes an ill-advised attempt to establish long-distance communication with Compo and Clegg by investing in some walkie-talkies. However, it doesn't take long for one of the units to fall foul of a tractor. Long-running rural comedy, with Brian Wilde, Peter Sallis and Bill Owen.(n)

programme.title: My Family
programme.desc: Ben comes up against an aggressive cyclist while out driving, and lands himself in trouble by speaking over the radio about bicycle-riders' lack of consideration on the roads. Susan faces an old rival while raising money for Kenzo's nursery, and a charitable gesture turns into a personal vendetta.(n)

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc: Jean searches for a manager to run the agency, while Lionel gets to work on the outline for an American mini-series based on their real-life romance. Comedy, starring Judi Dench and Geoffrey Palmer.(n)

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc: Jean and Lionel travel to Los Angeles to discuss turning their story into a film, but the brash executive deciding their fate doesn't allay their fears. Comedy, starring Judi Dench and Geoffrey Palmer.(n)

programme.title: My Hero
programme.desc: George is initially bewildered by preparations for Christmas, but soon decides to join in the festive fun by dressing up as Santa and creeping into the houses of Janet's parents and her boss's to leave them presents. Unfortunately, his plan backfires disastrously. Festive edition of the superhero comedy from 2000, starring Ardal O'Hanlon.(n)

programme.title: My Hero
programme.desc: Thermoman reveals his double identity to Janet's parents, but her mother can't keep a secret and her father is determined to interest him in model railways and cardigans. Comedy, starring Ardal O'Hanlon and Emily Joyce.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Compo, Clegg and Foggy are intrigued by some perfectly respectable men who turn up without their trousers, before they take part in an event sponsored by a village charity.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: Walking Stiff Can Make You Famous.
programme.desc: Feeling frustrated by his lack of fame, Foggy invents the sport of bicycle polo, convinced it will not only put his name in lights but prove a lucrative venture. Long-running comedy, starring Brian Wilde, Peter Sallis and Bill Owen.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Compo seizes the opportunity to break into the world of showbusiness when human cannonball Captain Zero cannot perform his act at the local garden fete. Trevor Peacock (The Vicar of Dibley) guest stars, with Bill Owen, Peter Sallis and Brian Wilde.(n)

programme.title: Boomers
programme.desc: Joyce and Alan have financial concerns and consider downsizing, but - hoping to keep it quiet for the time being - they don't count on their friends being there when the estate agent arrives to look round. Maureen has finally decided to move elderly mum Joan into a residential home, while the men convince John that his sister-in-law's over-friendly behaviour is actually a form of sexual harassment and, having put up with it for 40 years, he decides it's time he finally spoke up. Comedy, starring Alison Steadman, Philip Jackson, Russ Abbot and June Whitfield.(n)

programme.title: Boomers
programme.desc: They say age is but a number, and every year Joyce, Alan and the gang like to remind themselves of that by attending a 1960s-themed weekend at a seaside resort, and partying their evenings away. However, this time, Alan's in their bad books, having messed up the booking, leaving them with only two rooms between the six of them. Meanwhile, John is determined to prove he's not old and starts by taking on the climbing wall, and Carol bumps into an old friend, which could spell trouble for her relationship with Trevor. Comedy, starring Alison Steadman, Philip Jackson, Russ Abbot and Paula Wilcox.(n)

programme.title: Porridge: Inside Out
programme.desc: The final episode of the series examines life after the prison sitcom, remembering spin-off Going Straight and the untimely death of actor Richard Beckinsale.(n)

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Peace evades the inmates of Slade Prison, and Fletcher's bid to find a little tranquillity seems destined to fail. Comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and Brian Wilde.(n)

programme.title: Mrs Brown's Boys
programme.desc: Dermot's pre-marriage nerves get the better of him and he locks himself away in a cupboard, so it is up to Agnes, Father Quinn and best man Buster to try to calm him down. Meanwhile, Rory's secret is revealed to his mother. Bawdy comedy, starring Brendan O'Carroll and Paddy Houlihan.(n)

programme.title: Mrs Brown's Boys
programme.desc: Newlyweds Dermot and Maria argue over whether they should buy their own home. Meanwhile, Grandad hopes to witness his own funeral, but Mrs Brown's plans go awry when she mistakes two Mormons - who have been stealing Father Quinn's parishioners - for the men who are supposed to be delivering the coffin.(n)

programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc: Lucy announces to the friends that she is pregnant, causing Lee to wonder if he is the father. Comedy, starring Lee Mack as a man with a complicated relationship with his flatmate. With Sally Bretton, Tim Vine and Miranda Hart.(n)

programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc: Lee wins £1,000 for writing an essay entitled Disability in the Workplace, and Lucy is moved to tears by his sensitivity. However, Tim remains unconvinced, and his scepticism pays off when the journalist who turns up to cover the story is shocked to find an able-bodied author. Comedy, starring Lee Mack, Sally Bretton and Tim Vine.(n)

programme.title: The Trip
programme.sub-title: The Trip to Italy: Hotel Locarno, Rome.
programme.desc: Steve's assistant Emma joins him and Rob in Rome, where they also meet up with photographer Yolanda before visiting the Keats-Shelley Memorial House museum. They go on to their next restaurant, where Emma has a bit of news for them, and Rob and Steve compete with each other doing impressions of Marlon Brando's Don Corleone from The Godfather. Comedy, starring Steve Coogan and Rob Brydon.(n)

programme.title: Peep Show
programme.desc: Mark makes a new friend at a business conference and Jeremy reluctantly considers accepting Super Hans as a replacement flatmate - but soon decides against it. Offbeat comedy, starring Robert Webb, Olivia Coleman and David Mitchell.(n)

programme.title: Peep Show
programme.desc: Jeremy tries to impress Toni with his new job in a music studio, while Mark is disappointed at being passed over for promotion. Starring Robert Webb and David Mitchell.(n)

programme.title: The Trip
programme.sub-title: The Trip to Italy: Villa Cimbrone, Ravello.
programme.desc: Steve and Rob visit Pompeii and then have lunch at Relais Blu on the Sorrento coast, overlooking the isle of Capri. Continuing their journey by car they head to the next hotel, where Rob receives a call from his agent telling him he has got the part in the movie he auditioned for. Comedy, starring Steve Coogan and Rob Brydon.(n)

programme.title: The Trip
programme.sub-title: The Trip to Italy: Il Riccio, Capri.
programme.desc: Steve's son Joe and his assistant Emma join him and Rob on the final leg of their culinary tour of Italy as they take the ferry from Naples to Capri, where they have lunch at Il Riccio. Afterwards, Rob asks Emma for advice about whether he should go back to Lucy, while Steve tells Joe he is going to buy a house closer to him. Comedy, starring Steve Coogan and Rob Brydon.(n)

programme.title: Shooting Stars
programme.desc: Donna Air, Morwenna Banks, Griff Rhys Jones and Stephen Tompkinson join team captains Ulrika Jonsson and Mark Lamarr in the zany quiz show, hosted by Vic Reeves and Bob Mortimer.(n)

programme.title: Shooting Stars
programme.desc: Team captains Ulrika Jonsson and Mark Lamarr are joined by Goodie Tim Brooke-Taylor, Belinda Carlisle, Dennis Pennis and 1960s pop legend Reg Presley.(n)

programme.desc: Compo seizes the opportunity to break into the world of showbusiness when human cannonball Captain Zero cannot perform his act at the local garden fete. Trevor Peacock (The Vicar of Dibley) guest stars, with Bill Owen, Peter Sallis and Brian Wilde.(n)

programme.title: My Family
programme.desc: Janey gets involved with a married man and chaos ensues when his wife confronts Susan about the situation. Michael tries to raise money by `selling' his address to a couple looking to secure their child a place at the local school - but it does not go according to plan.(n)

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc: Jean insists on going back to work having returned from LA, certain she can overcome jet lag, but Lionel just wants to rest. Comedy, starring Judi Dench and Geoffrey Palmer.(n)

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc: Jean tries to organise a new secretary for Lionel, who is troubled by discussions regarding the mini-series. Rocky's honeymoon with Madge ends in hospital after an unfortunate canoeing accident. Judi Dench and Geoffrey Palmer star.(n)

programme.title: My Hero
programme.desc: A curvaceous Ultronian appears, claiming to be George's fiancee - and it falls to space pal Arnie to rescue the superhero from an alien wedding. Meanwhile, there's a crisis at the surgery as Mrs Raven negotiates her contract with an inattentive Piers. Comedy, starring Ardal O'Hanlon.(n)

programme.title: My Hero
programme.desc: Unemployed superhero Polarman seeks refuge in George's living room, while Janet's parents boast about Piers' new car, prompting Thermoman to take drastic action at the health food shop. Comedy, starring Ardal O'Hanlon and Emily Joyce.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Foggy plans to convert an old boat into a water taxi, but when work is finally completed Compo becomes obsessed with getting Nora Batty on board.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: The Empire That Foggy Nearly Built.
programme.desc: After witnessing an argument between two motorists over an available space, Foggy hits on another get-rich-quick scheme - this time in the form of a car-parking scheme. Rural comedy, starring Brian Wilde, Peter Sallis and Bill Owen.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: The Last Surviving Maurice Chevalier Impression.
programme.desc: Compo decides the way to win the heart of Nora Batty is to become a celebrity, so goes on a televised talent show. Gorden Kaye ('Allo 'Allo!) guest stars, alongside Bill Owen, Peter Sallis and Brian Wilde.(n)

programme.title: My Family
programme.desc: Janey gets involved with a married man and chaos ensues when his wife confronts Susan about the situation. Michael tries to raise money by `selling' his address to a couple looking to secure their child a place at the local school - but it does not go according to plan.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.sub-title: Miami Twice - Part One: The American Dream.
programme.desc: Part one of two. The Trotters get a chance to escape Peckham for a holiday in the Florida sun - but it means Del leaving his newborn son behind. David Jason and Nicholas Lyndhurst star, with Buster Merryfield, Tessa Peake-Jones, Gwyneth Strong, Denis Lill and Roger Lloyd Pack.(n)

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: The inmates decide on a wager as the parole board gathers, with Blanco odds-on favourite for release. However, the old lag turns down his freedom and leaves Fletcher in danger of losing a small fortune. Prison comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and David Jason.(n)

programme.title: Fawlty Towers
programme.desc: Basil goes to great lengths to prove to Sybil that a guest has smuggled a woman into his room. Instead the hotelier keeps being caught in compromising situations with a young Australian woman, and a visiting psychiatrist finds his increasingly manic behaviour both fascinating and alarming. Classic comedy first broadcast in 1979, starring John Cleese and Prunella Scales.(n)

programme.title: Fawlty Towers
programme.desc: A party of German guests comes to stay and Basil resolves to ensure everyone is on their best behaviour. Regrettably, a nasty case of concussion sustained during a fire drill ensures his plans come crashing down. Starring John Cleese, Prunella Scales and Andrew Sachs.(n)

programme.title: Bottom
programme.desc: Frustrated bachelors Richie and Eddie get their hands on a video camera following a spot of carnival-time looting, and decide to cash in by staging accidents and selling the tapes to a certain TV show. Comedy, starring Rik Mayall and Adrian Edmondson.(n)

programme.title: The Mighty Boosh
programme.desc: Dixon Bainbridge announces his intention to demolish the zoo to build a road, so Howard and Vince embark on a perilous journey into the Jungle Room to find the only man who can save them - missing adventurer Tommy Nookah. But first they have to get past a pack of wolves, which proves far more complicated than anticipated.(n)

programme.title: The Mighty Boosh
programme.desc: Famous publisher Hamilton Cork visits the zoo and Howard sees an opportunity to get the novel he has spent his life writing into print - but the esteemed guest is more interested in Vince's story about a character called Charlie. programme.title: MasterChef: The Professionals
programme.desc: Four chefs who have yet to face their skills test are challenged by Monica Galetti and Gregg Wallace to make creme patissiere and use it as a base for a souffle. They then recreate Michel Roux Jr's dish of lamb kidneys in a three-mustard sauce with a Savoyard potato cake, as well as a classic dish of their own choosing, before Monica and Michel decide which three contestants will advance to the quarter-final.(n)

programme.title: Hairy Bikers' Best of British
programme.desc: Si King and Dave Myers explore comfort food, preparing a rice pudding, as well as their own favourites of stuffed cabbage leaves and a flat-rib broth. They also investigate the history of the school dinner, see what Britons eat at the Notting Hill Carnival and examine a traditional Jewish Shabbat meal.(n)

programme.title: Peter Kuruvita's Coastal Kitchen
programme.desc: The chef shares recipes from Australia's Sunshine Coast and its hinterlands. To begin, he visits family run farms before making pho, a noodle soup.(n)

programme.title: Peter Kuruvita's Coastal Kitchen

programme.title: River Cottage
programme.desc: The potatoes and radishes are ready for picking and the broad beans are de-podded for a luxurious dish of beans on toast. programme.title: Choccywoccydoodah

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off
programme.desc: First-ever episode of the series in which enthusiastic home cooks take part in a contest to determine which of them is Britain's best amateur baker. The first stop on their nationwide tour is the Cotswolds, where judges Mary Berry and Paul Hollywood challenge them to make their signature cakes and tackle a recipe for Victoria sponge. The week's final task sees them producing a tricky chocolate celebration cake. Presented by Mel Giedroyc and Sue Perkins.(n)

programme.title: MasterChef: The Professionals
programme.desc: Monica Galetti and Michel Roux Jr oversee proceedings as six chefs battle it out in the quarter-final, preparing a dish of their own invention from a range of ingredients including oysters, whelks, mangos, white chocolate and dates. Only four contestants will make it to the next challenge, in which they have to cook two courses for food critics William Sitwell, Tracey MacLeod and Jay Rayner - with two going through to the semi-finals.(n)

programme.title: Hairy Bikers' Best of British
programme.desc: Si King and Dave Myers celebrate British beef, using it in a suet pudding and making oxtail soup. They visit a farmer who is focusing on the future with his wagyu cattle, discover the history of the much-maligned dish tripe and learn how to roast a whole ox.(n)

programme.title: Peter Kuruvita's Coastal Kitchen
programme.desc: Peter discovers the secrets of bush tucker and creates dishes inspired by these ingredients.(n)

programme.title: Peter Kuruvita's Coastal Kitchen
programme.desc: Peter meets with a community of passionate local producers, showcasing some of the finest and freshest produce in Australia's Sunshine Coast.(n)

programme.title: River Cottage
programme.desc: Hugh Fearnley-Whittingstall celebrates the arrival of summer with a fair. He prepares elderflower champagne and the Bristol families spit-roast pigs, lamb and goat. The final crops he still has to harvest are peas, gooseberries and wet garlic, at which time he will have experienced all that his land has to offer during his favourite season of the year.(n)

programme.title: Risky Business
programme.desc: Tom Cruise, in his breakthrough role, stars as a straight-A student left in charge of the house by his holidaying parents. Grabbing the Porsche, he heads downtown and picks up glamorous hooker Rebecca De Mornay. She's on the run from her pimp and when she sees Cruise's house, she has an idea - seduce him and persuade him to turn it into a high class bordello for just one night, so she and her friends can relieve his friends of their cash. All goes well until her pimp turns up looking for payback in Paul Brickman's sex comedy that rises above the genre to be both entertaining and provoking. Also starring Joe Pantoliano and Bronson Pinchot(n)

programme.title: The Music of Strangers: Yo-Yo Ma and the Silk Road Ensemble
programme.desc: Profiling cellist Yo-Yo Ma and his Silk Road Ensemble, a collective of musicians who tour the world to perform and teach their craft(n)

programme.title: Blues Brothers 2000
programme.desc: After their first adventure, Elwood was given a prison sentence of 18 years. Upon release he learns that his former partner Jake has died. Determined to get the band back together, he picks up 10-year-old Buster and Mack McTeer. They travel across the country to Louisiana for a battle of the bands(n)

programme.title: Welcome Home Roscoe Jenkins
programme.desc: Martin Lawrence stars in this uproarious farce about a successful self-help guru and TV talk-show host who finds himself embroiled in a series of comic disasters when he goes home to Georgia for his parents' 50th wedding anniversary. James Earl Jones, Margaret Avery, Joy Bryant, Cedric the Entertainer. Written and directed by Malcolm D. Lee(n)

programme.title: Making of 'The Zookeeper's Wife'
programme.desc: A look at "The Zookeeper's Wife," a 2017 drama based on Diane Ackerman's nonfiction book about a couple who used the Warsaw Zoo to save hundreds of Jews during the German occupation of Poland during World War II. The film stars Jessica Chastain, Johan Heldenbergh and Daniel Brühl, and is directed by Niki Caro(n)

programme.title: Beautiful Creatures
programme.desc: A bookish boy is bewitched by the new girl in his South Carolina town, but she and her family hide a powerful and magical secret(n)

programme.title: Making of 'Absolutely Fabulous: The Movie'
programme.desc: A look at "Absolutely Fabulous: The Movie," a 2016 adaptation of the popular British sitcom about hard-living ladies Edina and Patsy, who flee to the French Riviera after they accidentally cause the death of a celebrity at a posh party. The film stars Jennifer Saunders and Joanna Lumley, and is directed by Mandie Fletcher(n)

programme.title: Meet Dave
programme.desc: Eddie Murphy is twice the fun in dual roles in this out-of-this-world sci-fi comedy. He's captain of a crew of tiny aliens who man a spaceship shaped like a human-sized replica of him. They've come to Earth to find a way to save their doomed planet. The big guy falls in love with a widowed mother (Elizabeth Banks) with a history of hooking up with a series of Mr. Wrongs. Directed by Brian Robbins(n)

programme.title: The Green Mile
programme.desc: Set in the Depression of the '30s in southern United States, this drama portrays the remarkable relationship established between Paul Edgecomb (Tom Hanks), a prison guard on Death Row, and John Coffey (Michael Clarke Duncan), a hefty colored man sentenced to death for a brutal double homicide. As the days go by, and after some surprising experiences, Edgecomb begins to have doubts about Coffey's culpability. He is a naïve, apprehensive man with a supernatural gift. Based on a novel by Stephen King, this drama received four Oscar nominations(n)

programme.title: Casper
programme.desc: Based on the popular cartoon character, this family-oriented "ghost story" is about a not-so-scary spirit who bonds with a little girl (Christina Ricci). The eternally irritable Ms. Carrigan (Cathy Moriarty) discovers that the only thing she's been left in her recently departed father's will is a rickety old house in New England. Naturally, the woman is furious about this, until her "close personal friend" and assistant, Dibbs (Eric Idle of Monty Python fame), discovers a secret message that a treasure may be concealed somewhere in the house. The two take off for Maine, only to learn that the house is haunted by Casper "the friendly ghost" and his three ghostly uncles Stinky, Stretch, and Fatso. After futilely recruiting an exorcist (Don Novello, more or less reviving his Father Guido Sarducci character from Saturday Night Live) and a "professional ghost exterminator" (Dan Aykroyd), she brings in a "ghost psychiatrist" (Bill Pullman) and his daughter Kat (Ricci). Innocently attracted to the young girl, Casper befriends Kat as they try to save the ghosts' home from the evil Carrigan. Eye-popping special effects highlight this magical story that touches (albeit lightly) on the theme of what lies at the heart of human desires. Clint Eastwood, Rodney Dangerfield, Mel Gibson and The Crypt Keeper (of Tales from the Crypt) all make cameos as apparitions in the mirror Bill Pullman looks into in the house(n)

programme.title: The Huntsman: Winter's War
programme.desc: This spin-off of Snow White and the Huntsman acts as both prequel and sequel to the original film, detailing the adventures of Eric the Huntsman (Chris Hemsworth) as he gets caught up in the rivalry between wicked queens Ravenna (Charlize Theron) and Freya (Emily Blunt). During his quest, Eric is also endangered by his feelings for fellow warrior Sara (Jessica Chastain), since ice queen Freya has decreed that love is forbidden in her kingdom. Directed by Cedric Nicolas-Troyan(n)

programme.title: Crimson Peak
programme.desc: A mysterious stranger woos and transports a young woman to a crumbling dwelling atop a clay mountain, where she soon learns he has many secrets in the haunted mansion that will leave her fighting for her sanity and her very life(n)

programme.desc: Legal thriller about a brilliant engineer trying to get away with murder and the dogged prosecutor on his tail(n)

programme.desc: Wade Wilson, a former mercenary, is tricked into volunteering as the subject of a bizarre experiment that gives him superhuman abilities. programme.desc: A common thief named Bek enlists the help of powerful god Horus in a quest to defeat Set, an evil god who has plunged a once peaceful Egypt into the darkness. The survival of mankind and the fate of his lover lies in the hands of the unlikely mortal hero(n)

programme.title: My Big Fat Greek Wedding 2
programme.desc: In this charming sequel to the 2002 sleeper hit, Toula's family throws an even bigger Greek wedding for her parents, who learn they never officially tied the knot. Meanwhile, she deals with a daughter who's eager to escape from her overbearing clan(n)

programme.title: Cast Away
programme.desc: FedEx employee Chuck Noland lives his life by clockwork. But his promise to his girlfriend to be back from Moscow for New Year looks doubtful when a terrifying plane crash strands him on a Pacific island(n)

programme.title: Big Little Lies
programme.desc: Burning Love. Madeline worries about Jane and the can of worms she opened. Meanwhile, Jane confronts Renata; Bonnie tells Nathan about Abigail's secret project; and Ed and Madeline have a candid conversation about the lack of passion in their marriage(n)

programme.title: Mr. Right
programme.desc: Martha finally finds her Mr Right, but he has just one flaw: he is a hitman on the run from his former employers, a crime cartel(n)

programme.title: 10,000 B.C.
programme.desc: When a band of mysterious horse-riding warlords raid the Yaghal camp and kidnaps the beautiful Evolet along with many others, young mammoth hunter D'Leh is forced to lead a small group of hunters south to save her. Driven by destiny, the unlikely band of warriors must also battle saber-toothed cats and terror birds(n)

programme.title: 2 Days: Vasyl Lomachenko
programme.desc: A 48-hour visit with junior-lightweight boxer Vasyl Lomachenko(n)

programme.title: Real Sports With Bryant Gumbel
programme.desc: Segments include a report on former Maryland Terps basketball player Juan Dixon; a profile of 2004 top MLB draft pick Matt Bush; and an examination of the "yips," including a chat with former baseball player Rick Ankiel(n)

programme.title: Interview With the Vampire
programme.desc: Engrossing character study about the life of a vampire, whose conscience stops him from killing humans. From an original story by Anne Rice, who also provided the screenplay(n)

programme.title: The Green Mile
programme.desc: Set in the Depression of the '30s in southern United States, this drama portrays the remarkable relationship established between Paul Edgecomb (Tom Hanks), a prison guard on Death Row, and John Coffey (Michael Clarke Duncan), a hefty colored man sentenced to death for a brutal double homicide. As the days go by, and after some surprising experiences, Edgecomb begins to have doubts about Coffey's culpability. He is a naïve, apprehensive man with a supernatural gift. Based on a novel by Stephen King, this drama received four Oscar nominations(n)

programme.title: Friday
programme.desc: A typical day in the life of Craig, an alright guy with some crazy friends. Like Smokey, who has 24 hours to pay back Deebo, South Central's nastiest thug - or else. Trouble is, neither Craig's mother nor his main squeeze have the cash. As time ticks away, the chance this pair will ever see Saturday is fading fast(n)

programme.title: Bait Shop
programme.desc: A small-town bait-shop owner competes in a fishing contest against a showboating pro in order to win the cash he needs to save his floundering business(n)

programme.title: Code Name: The Cleaner
programme.desc: Jake wakes up in a hotel room next to a dead FBI agent, a suitcase full of cash and no memory. But should he believe the woman who claims to be his wife when she tells him he's a member of Special Ops?(n)

programme.title: Life with Mikey
programme.desc: Mikey used to be a child star. These days, he's just a talent scout looking for kids with prospects, until pint-sized Angie picks his pocket. Mikey hears her sob story and sees his ticket back to the big time. Family comedy(n)

programme.title: The World According to Garp
programme.desc: Garp's an aspiring novelist, who's mother, Jenny is, an unmarried, unorthodox, feminist. Garp succeeds in publishing his novel, at the same time that his mother publishes her first feminist manifesto. Though successful and happily married to his college sweetheart, Helen, Garp still envys his fearless mother(n)

programme.title: The Breakfast Club
programme.desc: Teen-angst comedy drama. Five total strangers - an athlete, a spoiled rich kid, a brainy nerd, an introverted loner and a rebellious punk - are brought together on a day-long detention where they break the rules, bare their souls and find they have more in common than just attending the same high school. One of the plethora of 80s teen films, John Hughes's bittersweet 'brat pack' comedy has many perceptive moments(n)

programme.title: Bride Wars
programme.desc: Best friends Liv and Emma discover their dream weddings have been booked at the same venue on the same date and an epic catfight ensues(n)

programme.title: Making of 'Ride Along 2'
programme.desc: A look at "Ride Along 2," a 2016 comedy that follows an aspiring cop and his veteran partner—and future brother-in-law—as they pursue a Miami drug lord. The sequel to the 2014 hit stars Ice Cube, Kevin Hart and Benjamin Bratt, and is directed by Tim Story(n)

programme.title: Puerto Ricans in Paris
programme.desc: Two Puerto Rican cops are asked by a pair of French fashion designers to come to Paris to hunt down the counterfeiters who stole a couture handbag(n)

programme.title: Neighbors 2: Sorority Rising
programme.desc: Young parents Mac and Kelly find that their neighbor troubles are far from over when a hedonistic sorority moves in next door in this hysterical comedy sequel. During their feud with the ladies, the couple team up with ex-fratboy Teddy, who tormented them the last time around(n)

programme.title: P.S. I Love You
programme.desc: Young widow Holly Kennedy discovers that her late husband has left her ten monthly messages intended to help ease her pain and start a new life. Adapted from Cecelia Ahern's best-selling novel. Starring Hilary Swank, Gerard Butler, Kathy Bates and Lisa Kudrow(n)

programme.title: Mr. Right
programme.desc: Martha finally finds her Mr Right, but he has just one flaw: he is a hitman on the run from his former employers, a crime cartel(n)

programme.title: Last Week Tonight With John Oliver
programme.desc: American Health Care Act. The American Health Care Act proposed by Republicans; International Women's Day; and Wikileaks' CIA document dump are discussed(n)

programme.title: Mike and Dave Need Wedding Dates
programme.desc: Two hard-partying ladies see a viral video in which unruly brothers plead for dates for their sister's wedding in Hawaii, and decide to pose as the angels they're looking for in order to score a free trip in this incredibly raunchy comedy(n)

programme.title: Veep
programme.desc: Crate. Thornhill leads in the polls, so Selina and her staff wonder how to make her more down-to-earth. Meanwhile, Jonah meets with strategist Bill Ericsson about a job; and a pompous journalist interviews the vice president(n)

programme.title: Veep
programme.desc: New Hampshire. The Season 3 finale unfolds on the days leading up to the New Hampshire primary as Selina and her staff deal with multiple obligations and campaign stops(n)

programme.title: Bride Wars
programme.desc: Best friends Liv and Emma discover their dream weddings have been booked at the same venue on the same date and an epic catfight ensues(n)

programme.title: The Breakfast Club
programme.desc: Teen-angst comedy drama. Five total strangers - an athlete, a spoiled rich kid, a brainy nerd, an introverted loner and a rebellious punk - are brought together on a day-long detention where they break the rules, bare their souls and find they have more in common than just attending the same high school. One of the plethora of 80s teen films, John Hughes's bittersweet 'brat pack' comedy has many perceptive moments(n)

programme.title: Rocket Science
programme.desc: Coming-of-age saga examining the sometimes torturous, sometimes rewarding high-school experience. The extremely talented Reece Daniel Thompson portrays a stuttering teen who joins the school's debate squad and falls in love with a female teammate (Anna Kendrick). Written and directed by Jeffrey Blitz, who chronicled spelling-bee competitions in the documentary "Spellbound." Blitz also overcame his own teenage stuttering problem. The soundtrack features music by the Violent Femmes(n)

programme.title: My Big Fat Greek Wedding
programme.desc: One woman's rocky road to the altar gets played for laughs in this comedy, adapted from the one-woman off-Broadway show written by and starring Nia Vardalos. Toula (Vardalos) is a Greek-American woman who is in her early thirties and single, with no immediate prospects of changing that status any time soon. This bothers Toula a bit, but not half as much as it distresses her mother (Lainie Kazan) and father (Michael Constantine), who want to send her to Greece in hopes of finding a husband in the old country. Toula isn't interested in leaving the country to find a man, but since she works in the family business -- a Greek restaurant in Chicago called Dancing Zorba's -- she has to hear about it whether she likes it or not. One day, after seeing a handsome stranger in the restaurant and not having the courage to talk to him, Toula decides she needs a bit of self-improvement. Despite her dad's misgivings, Toula signs up for a night-school class studying computers, trades in her glasses for contact lenses, gets a different job at a travel agency, and spruces herself up with a new look and a new attitude. To her very pleasant surprise, she once again encounters the handsome stranger, who soon asks her out on a date. Schoolteacher Ian Miller (John Corbett) is seemingly perfect -- he's tall, handsome, smart, good-natured, and soon in love with Toula -- except for two little things: he's not Greek, and he's a vegetarian, both of which horrify Toula's family. When Ian pops the question (and Toula says yes), the bride-to-be has to negotiate a reasonably peaceful meeting between Ian's upper-class parents and her own working-class extended family. There's also the matter of the wedding, which Toula's mother is planning around the notion that quantity IS quality. My Big Fat Greek Wedding also features Ian Gomez (Vardalos' real-life husband), Louis Mandylor, Andrea Martin, and Joey Fatone (from the pop group *NSYNC). Tom Hanks and Rita Wilson helped produce the film through the auspices of their production company, Playtone(n)

programme.title: The Wedding Singer
programme.desc: Romantic comedy about a failed songwriter-turned-singer who makes a living on the wedding circuit in the 1980s. After being jilted at his own wedding, he becomes disillusioned about romance, but his spirits are soon lifted by a waitress who works at the same events(n)

programme.title: Ride Along 2
programme.desc: Friction continues between a rookie cop and his seasoned partner (who's also his future brother-in-law) in this sidesplitting action comedy. After discovering a mysterious flash drive during an arrest, the pair travel to Miami to hunt down a drug lord with the help of a savvy detective(n)

programme.title: The Family Man
programme.desc: Wall Street Banker Jack Campbell has it all: more cash than he can shake a stick at, oodles of power and, above all, his freedom. But on Christmas Eve he challenges an armed robber, then on Christmas Day he wakes up to the life he would have had if he'd stayed with his college girlfriend: two noisy kids, a dead-end job selling tyres, and a people carrier instead of his Ferrari. At first he's horrified(n)

programme.title: Men in Black II
programme.desc: Action-packed sequel to the sci-fi comedy about a top secret government task force set up to deal with unruly extraterrestrials. An MIB agent turns to his former mentor to help him save the world from a rampaging, shape-shifting alien who has taken on the outward appearance of a sexy lingerie model(n)

programme.title: Sixteen Candles
programme.desc: On the eve of her sister's wedding, suburban teenager Samantha suffers silently as her family forgets her birthday. Even worse, some total dork keeps propositioning her with sophomoric innuendo when she really craves romantic attention from high-school hunk Jake. This bittersweet teen comedy traces the hopes and disappointments not only of Samantha, but also a host of incidental but memorable characters..(n)

programme.title: Keanu
programme.desc: Two bumbling friends posing as drug dealers in order to retrieve a stolen cat(n)

programme.title: How to Be Single
programme.desc: Eligible young people in New York City search for romance while living the single life with their friends(n)

programme.title: Do the Right Thing
programme.desc: A local black community is unhappy that their community is effectively being run by whites. As the heat rises on a hot summer's day in Brooklyn, so the racial tension, which has so far lay dormant under the surface, begins to rise(n)

programme.title: Jerrod Carmichael: Love at the Store
programme.desc: Comedian Jerrod Carmichael performs at The Comedy Store in Hollywood. Topics include poverty; crime; national tragedies; and talent versus morals(n)

programme.title: Jerrod Carmichael: 8
programme.desc: Comedian Jerrod Carmichael performs in New York City at Masonic Hall. Topics include Donald Trump's victory; climate change; supporting the troops; animal rights; being a good boyfriend; and his top four fears(n)

programme.title: Veep
programme.desc: Joint Session. In the Season 4 premiere, Selina makes her first major speech as president to Congress, but her staff struggles to make sense of her message. Meanwhile, Gary worries about his limited access to Selina; Jonah is wary of the new vice president's chief of staff; and Amy has a meeting with ruthless political operative Bill Ericsson(n)

programme.title: Veep
programme.desc: East Wing. The Israeli prime minister visits Washington, D.C., but Gary gets carried away planning the dinner. Meanwhile, Mike tries out a new look; Teddy does Jonah a favor; Amy learns about a staff shake-up; and a painting in the White House becomes a hot topic(n)

programme.title: Ride Along 2
programme.desc: Friction continues between a rookie cop and his seasoned partner (who's also his future brother-in-law) in this sidesplitting action comedy. After discovering a mysterious flash drive during an arrest, the pair travel to Miami to hunt down a drug lord with the help of a savvy detective(n)

programme.title: Batman
programme.desc: Michael Keaton is Bruce Wayne, an enigmatic millionaire who, following the trauma of witnessing his parent's death as a child, dons a voluminous black cape by night to become the Batman, a shadowy figure who haunts the streets of Gotham City, fighting crime wherever it rears its ugly head. And it doesn't come much uglier than The Joker, a cackling killer with a frozen rictus grin whose deadly laughing gas threatens to wipe out the population of Gotham(n)

programme.title: Ice Princess
programme.desc: In this funny and touching family film, a brainy high-school student (Michelle Trachtenberg) dreams of becoming a champion figure skater. programme.title: Space Chimps
programme.desc: In Kirk DeMicco's animated film three supersonic simian spacemen take to the cosmos to find a missing probe, and encounter a whole world of trouble along the way. Ham III, the grandson of the first ever chimp in space, is a wise-cracking smart aleck who makes a living being fired from a cannon. When the Infinity Space Probe goes missing, Ham joins a mission to find it. He's been recruited as a PR stunt, but his fellow Space Chimps, Luna and Titan, are highly trained experts. When they crash-land on the planet Malgor, they find a race of aliens who are being oppressed by the tyrannical Zartog, who is using the probe for his own nefarious ends. Can the feckless Ham use his circus skills to save the day, help liberate the aliens, recover the probe, get the girl, and find a way to get back home? This is great fare for all the family, with plenty of deadpan asides to keep grown-ups entertained(n)

But when he has a fling with Erika Christensen in the pool one night then dumps her, he soon realises that a woman scorned is a dangerous woman. John Polson's film, which has been compared to Fatal Attraction, is a taut thriller with genuinely scary moments as Christensen becomes more psychotic(n)

Now, as well as facing the computer's weaponry, they must tackle the living dead to prevent the virus escaping into the outside world. Paul W Anderson's horror thriller is based on the successful computer game(n)

At the same time, a CIA analyst arrives at a clandestine detention facility outside of United States. programme.title: Rosewood
programme.desc: A true story. It is January 1, 1923 in Rosewood, but in this largely black town built on family, faith and hard work, hopes for the New Year abruptly end. In a few harrowing nights, a white mob razes Rosewood into oblivion. As the rampage gains cataclysmic force, a heroic World War I veteran and a shopkeeper join forces. Dozens of terrified women and children have fled into nearby swamps. Somehow they must be led to safety(n)

programme.title: Blast From the Past
programme.desc: At the height of the Cuban missile crisis in the 1960s, Calvin Webber takes his pregnant wife Helen underground into a cavernous air raid shelter. Misinterpreting a plane crash as war, they spend the next 35 years entombed there. Their son, Adam, is brought up learning foreign languages, dancing, boxing and playing in the astro-turfed 'back yard'. When he is sent to get supplies from the world above, he meets Eve and, in this romantic comedy, discovers the good and bad sides of 1990s America(n)

programme.title: The Forest

programme.title: Criminal

Carlito is determined to go straight, but he agrees to take part in a lucrative shady business deal at his attorney's instigation - figuring to discharge the debt of gratitude he owes. Despite his intentions, he finds himself relentlessly drawn back into the world he sought to escape(n)

programme.title: The Huntsman: Winter's War

During his quest, Eric is also endangered by his feelings for fellow warrior Sara (Jessica Chastain), since ice queen Freya has decreed that love is forbidden in her kingdom. Directed by Cedric Nicolas-Troyan(n)

programme.desc: Jim Carrey is two times as good as usual, playing dual roles in this prime psychological thriller. He stars as a dogcatcher who becomes obsessed with the titular digits after reading a book about them. He also plays a fictional detective who narrates the events as they creepily unfold and involve his wife (Virginia Madsen) and best friend (Danny Huston). Directed by Joel Schumacher. John Fink, Mark Pellegrino, Ed Lauter, Rhona Mitra(n)

programme.title: Closed Circuit

programme.title: Heartbreakers
programme.desc: A mother-daughter team of con artists target wealthy men for their fortunes(n)

programme.title: Marley & Me
programme.desc: The Devil Wears Prada director David Frankel's light comedy-drama - based on a best-selling autobiography - stars Owen Wilson and Jennifer Aniston as a pair of married journalists who welcome a truly unruly dog into their lives. Relocating to Florida, newlyweds John and Jenny Grogan end up working for rival newspapers, and it's soon obvious that Jenny has landed the more high-profile job. But when she starts to become broody, one of John's colleagues suggests they see how they cope with a puppy before trying for a baby. John duly picks a cute yellow Labrador Retriever as a gift for his spouse. It's quickly clear their acquisition is something of a double-edged sword: he's an untrainably anarchic source of destruction; but he also gives John the material for a wry newspaper column, which greatly increases his standing.The film follows the trajectory of the Grogans' marriage, through good times and bad, and the stuff of everyday life, with the dog providing comic relief and the leads turning in convincing, heart-warming performances(n)

programme.title: Baby Mama
programme.desc: In a side-splitting film that brings together some of comedy's sharpest talent, 30 Rock star Tina Fey, Amy Poehler and writer/director Michael McCullers join forces to tell the story of two women, one apartment and the nine months that will change their lives. The always winning and wry Fey portrays a focused and driven New York career woman who desperately wants a baby but is physically unable to carry the child herself. Undaunted, she recruits a South Philly working girl (Poehler) to act as her surrogate. Everything goes according to plan until a pregnant Poehler shows up on Fey's doorstep with no place to live, and suddenly two very different women are joined together to create a very unexpected family(n)

programme.title: Slumdog Millionaire
programme.desc: (2008) Danny Boyle's eight Oscar- and seven BAFTA-winning blockbuster opens as Jamal Malik (Dev Patel), a chaiwalah at a call centre, is on the verge of winning 20 million rupees on Who Wants to Be a Millionaire? . But the host of the show, Prem Kumar (Anil Kapoor) is convinced he's cheating and hands him over to the police to beat the truth out of him. Jamal reveals that the right answer to each question has come from a significant part of his life, from when he and his brother Salim were orphaned after their mother was killed in religious violence. As he continues his story, Jamal reveals how he knows each answer; how he fell in love with Latika, an orphaned girl from whom he was later separated; and how his brother Salim took the path of violence as a gangster's gunman. But as Jamal is returned to the studio for the last question, Salim finally repays his brother's trust. As well as the outstanding Patel, Jamal is played in different stages of his life by Tanay Hemant Gharu and Ayush Mahesh Khedekar; Salim is played by Madhur Mittal, Ashutosh Lobo Gajiwala and Azharuddin Mohammed Ismail; Latika is played by Frieda Pinto, Tanvi Ganesh Lonkar and Rubina Ali, all of whom turn in stunning performances. English/ Hindi with English subtitles(n)

programme.desc: Stewie meets a kindred spirit who shares his love of advanced weaponry, and Lois buys twin beds when she grows tired of being crushed by Peter, who subsequently struggles to fall asleep without a night-time cuddle. With guest star Cate Blanchett.(n)

Rural drama, starring Philip Middlemiss, Kelly Wenham and Danny Seward.(n)

programme.desc: Village newcomer Vivienne Mackay is found battered to death in her own kitchen after announcing her intention to marry businessman Dominic Bellingham - who has not yet separated from his current wife. programme.title: Where the Heart Is

Whodunit, starring Geraldine McEwan as Miss Marple, with Jane Asher, Jason Flemying, Derek Jacobi and Miriam Margoyles.(n)

Action drama, with Martin Shaw, Lewis Collins and Gordon Jackson.(n)

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: The sleuth has retired to a charming English village in the hope of finding peace and quiet. However, the murder of a rich industrialist neighbour forces him to leave his new lifestyle behind as he plunges into a sordid world of blackmail and envy, aided by the dogged Chief Inspector Japp. Whodunit, starring David Suchet, Philip Jackson, Malcolm Terris and Oliver Ford Davies.(n)

programme.title: The Great Fire
programme.desc: Drama detailing the stories of the people of London during the Great Fire of 1666. Widower and single father Thomas Farriner is the king's baker, currently providing the Navy with bread and biscuits from his Pudding Lane bakery. His sister-in-law Sarah often helps out at the shop - a distraction from the fact her wayward husband (Thomas's brother) has been missing at sea for months now. Thomas is dismayed to learn from Navy official Samuel Pepys that it's unlikely he'll be paid for his latest job, owing to the expense of the war against the Dutch. However, he instead sends the baker away with a letter that could be the key to Sarah's closure. Meanwhile, in the palace of Whitehall, the king attends a stately dance, where an attempt on his life is foiled. Later, Thomas returns to find the bakery ablaze, with his two daughters asleep upstairs. Starring Andrew Buchan, Rose Leslie and Jack Huston.(n)

programme.title: The Great Fire
programme.desc: Thomas bursts into his sister-in-law's lodgings to wake his family and lead them to safety, but Sarah is nowhere to be seen. Held in a private cell at Newgate Prison, she's waiting to be interrogated by Lord Denton about a possible Catholic plot against the king. Meanwhile, Samuel brings news of the rapidly spreading blaze to Charles, who surveys the damage from the safety of the river. From this vantage point, the monarch is shocked into action, ordering his advisers to compensate the public and tear down buildings to create firebreaks, but Hyde and Ashley-Cooper have other ideas.(n)

programme.title: The Halcyon
programme.desc: Drama set in 1940 at a five-star London hotel, showing the impact of the Second World War on families, politics, relationships and work across every social strata. The Halcyon's owner Lord Hamilton holds a secret meeting that attracts the interest of American guest Joe O'Hara, while manager Richard Garland must deal with the arrival of Lady Hamilton a day earlier than expected. Starring Olivia Williams, Steven Mackintosh, Alex Jennings and Matt Ryan.(n)

programme.title: Harlots

programme.title: Undeniable
programme.desc: Part one of two. Jane Phillips was just a young child when she witnessed her mother's murder and the traumatic incident has haunted her ever since. Twenty-three years later, she comes face to face with the man she believes is the killer - eminent oncologist Andrew Rawlins - and sets out to bring him to justice. However, having wrongly identified others in the past, is she about to destroy an innocent person's life? As inquiries proceed, inconsistencies emerge in both their testimonies and the suspect reluctantly submits to a blood test, which the original investigating officer believes will prove his guilt. Drama, starring Claire Goose and Peter Firth, with Felix Scott, Christine Bottomley, Pippa Haywood and Robert Pugh.(n)

programme.title: Undeniable
programme.desc: Conclusion. In spite of Andrew's DNA test results establishing his innocence, Jane remains convinced she is right and her determination to prove his guilt becomes increasingly irrational and obsessive. Her life unravelling, it seems all hope is lost when her ally, Detective Ali Hall, is relieved of the investigation. However, a confrontation with the oncologist's daughter Emma hardens Jane's resolve and triggers a series of consequences that neither of them could have foreseen. Drama, starring Claire Goose and Peter Firth, with Felix Scott, Christine Bottomley, Pippa Haywood and Robert Pugh.(n)

Philip Jackson, David Suchet and Hugh Fraser star.(n)

programme.title: Scott & Bailey
programme.desc: Syndicate 9 find themselves dealing with a high-profile historical case after Mandy Sweeting's body is recovered from a quarry, 23 years after she was first reported missing. However, Rachel's biggest challenge might not be dealing with the media attention or even re-interviewing bereft family members, but hiding her contempt for Rob Waddington's father Frankie (former Coronation Street star Ian Mercer), who led the original investigation. Meanwhile, Janet also has problems to deal with at home, as Elise moves in with her dad and his new girlfriend. But at least it inspires the detective to look at her own love life, as she confides in Rachel that she's started using dating sites. Crime drama, starring Suranne Jones, Lesley Sharp and Danny Miller.(n)

programme.title: Scott & Bailey
programme.desc: Rachel promised the chaos of her personal life was all in the past, but she is conflicted upon discovering her mother's new boyfriend is a violent domestic abuser. Meanwhile, Janet gets cold feet when she goes on her first date, terrified at the idea of having to impress a stranger. The crimebusters are united in the search for the killer of Rich Hutchings, who is found murdered in the flat he shares with his husband Adam. Barry, their outspoken and violent homophobic neighbour, is the prime suspect. However, as Adam's friend Tim struggles to recall the events of their night out, it seems Barry may be in the clear. Meanwhile, Rachel is horrified when her mum Sharon turns up asking for help. Crime drama, starring Suranne Jones, Lesley Sharp and Danny Miller.(n)

However, when the pair investigate further, they find the alleged victim alive and well with his family. Elsewhere, Margaret's visits to the vicarage begin to leave Mrs Maguire irritated, Leonard is distracted by secretive trips to the cinema, and Geordie is compelled to deal with a surprising shoplifter. Drama set in the 1950s, starring James Norton and Robson Green.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Pastoral care manager Steven Booth hosts the second Merseyside dinner party, and names each course after a Tina Turner song, hoping to win the £1,000 prize. The food is well received, but tensions rise when one guest makes a tactless comment.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Glamorous PR representative Jade Chantelle hosts the third night in Merseyside, where she hopes a casino-themed evening with lashings of champagne and a high-class menu will help her to win the £1,000 prize.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Primary school teacher Anna Senior hosts the fourth night in Merseyside with a fairy tale-themed evening. programme.title: Come Dine with Me

programme.desc: Joy and Phil Keep are contemplating a fresh start, but cannot decide where to relocate. Joy prefers a peaceful lifestyle in rural Lincolnshire, while Phil fancies living in a sun-drenched place such as Malta or Gozo. Experts Laura Hamilton and Jonnie Irwin show the couple desirable houses in both locations in a bid to help them reach a decision.(n)

programme.title: Time Team
programme.sub-title: Stonton Wyville, Leicestershire: Saxons on the Edge.
programme.desc: Tony and the team are in Stonton Wyville, Leicestershire to investigate evidence of an Anglo-Saxon settlement after locals found pieces of 1,200-year-old pottery in a field.(n)

programme.title: Time Team
programme.sub-title: Hunstrete, Somerset: Keeping Up with the Georgians.
programme.desc: Tony Robinson and the team descend on a field outside Bath to search for the remains of the Georgian house built 200 years previously by local MP Francis Popham. A set of stone arches is all that remains of the property, but two oil paintings suggest it was once one of the grandest homes in Britain - although the results of the dig tell a very different story.(n)

programme.title: Car SOS
programme.desc: Car enthusiast Tim Shaw and master mechanic Fuzz Townshend travel to Leicestershire to rescue a Jaguar E-Type. After ill health turned school caretaker Mick's dream of owning one the 1960s supercars into a nightmare, the team is on hand to get the iconic car back on the road.(n)

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: A woman and her sons bring in their springer spaniel puppy for complicated surgery on its badly deformed hind leg. programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: Cavachon Stampy has been hit by a car and is in a critical condition, leaving owners Jim and his wife Karen facing a difficult dilemma - to take the chance and put their pet through painful surgery, or let him die. Golden retriever Dylan has a limp, and owner Stuart has driven seven hours from Preston to seek Noel Fitzpatrick's help. Meanwhile, Ginny from Chelsea arrives with her beloved dachshund Lilly-Belle, who has lost the use of her back legs.(n)

programme.title: Princess Diana's Dresses: The Auction
programme.desc: Documentary exploring the stories behind some of Diana, Princess of Wales's most memorable outfits - a collection of couture dresses that was put up for auction in March at the biggest-ever UK sale of her clothes. From the 25ft train of her wedding gown to the midnight blue off-the-shoulder creation she wore while famously dancing with John Travolta in 1985, the programme provides an insight into how Diana used her wardrobe to express her individuality and asks what motivated her fashion decisions.(n)

programme.title: The Mega Brothel
programme.desc: Documentary taking a look inside a brothel in Germany to explore what life is like for the women, clients and management in a country with some of the most liberal prostitution laws in the world. The high-end, five-storey Paradise club in Stuttgart is owned by Jurgen Rudloff, whose approach to attracting customers is to present the business as a spa for `the wellness of a man' with a sauna and steam room on offer.(n)

programme.desc: Shop manager Nicola Steele hosts the first dinner party in Cardiff, and hopes that her dog-themed surprises and unusual entertainment will impress her guests - army wife Rachael Smith, casting agency owner Jerry Lockett, childminder Andrea Grainger and chatterbox Sam Clark - and win her the £1,000 cash prize.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Jerry Lockett hosts the second dinner party in Cardiff, and following a flood at his home, hopes to impress his guests by serving the meal at the grand venue of his cousin's mansion.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Army wife Rachael Smith hosts the third party in Cardiff, allowing her competitive edge and no-nonsense approach to come to the fore in her bid to pick up the £1,000 prize.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Costume designer Sam Clarke prepares a Mexican menu for the fourth dinner party in Cardiff. Everything does not go to plan, however, when two guests begin fighting at the table, and his `fun' game leaves everyone in tears.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Childminder Andrea Grainger hosts the last dinner party as the competition in Cardiff draws to a close. She hopes a menu of traditional Welsh dishes will help her secure the prize, and lines up a selection of games to improve her chances of success. As the evening comes to an end, the diners discover which of the meals made the best impression.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Summer Sun
programme.desc: Sara Damergi assists a couple seeking a property on the southern Spanish Costa Blanca with beautiful views. The presenter shows Val and Reg Thorne what their £82,000 budget will stretch to, but has difficulty finding a house that the pair can agree on.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Summer Sun
programme.desc: Sara Damergi takes Savita and Vinod Patel from Hertfordshire house-hunting in and around the picturesque town of Denia on Spain's Costa Blanca. The couple must choose between the convenience of the town and the amazing views on offer just a little farther afield.(n)

programme.title: Time Team
programme.sub-title: Coberley, Gloucestershire: Mysteries of the Mosaic.
programme.desc: Tony Robinson and the team head to a Cotswolds field, where they suspect the great and the good of Roman Britain once built their homes. However, an extensive dig reveals that the site was once a hub of worship for Bacchus, the pagan god of wine and entertainment, and its destruction was a result of iconoclasm practised by early Roman Christians.(n)

programme.title: Time Team
programme.sub-title: Padstow, Cornwall: From Constantinople to Cornwall.
programme.desc: Tony Robinson and the team head to Padstow, Cornwall, to investigate why 1,500-year-old pottery and metalwork originating in North Africa and Turkey have been discovered by locals. The geophysics results suggest the field in which they were found may have contained an Iron Age village, while the archaeologists suspect the nearby sandy cove may have been a port dealing with traders from throughout the Mediterranean.(n)

programme.title: Car SOS
programme.desc: Presenter Tim Shaw and master mechanic Fuzz Townshend head to Brighton to secretly restore a 1984 Audi UR Quattro, which has been under a tarpaulin on a drive for 10 years. Owner Barry has dreamed of working on the vehicle, but health issues have left him sapped of energy and unable to fulfil his wish.(n)

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: A woman who suffers from nocturnal epileptic fits brings in Pearl, a Staffordshire Bull Terrier that can sense when her episodes are about to happen. However, the dog has problems with its knees and struggles to walk, so the pressure is on for Professor Noel Fitzpatrick to restore it back to full health. Plus, an Irish Setter has a cancerous tumour in its front leg, and a cat needs its jaw wiring back together after being hit by a car.(n)

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: A poodle called Diamond has been referred for a total hip replacement, and another, with the same owner, needs a new knee. Noel Fitzpatrick operates on both dogs on the same day, and doesn't finish until 3am. Hopity, a 12-week-old Balinese kitten, has a deformity on one of her back legs, which she could end up losing, while the operation itself is a huge risk. Hazell has brought in Dandi, a five month-old German shepherd who is lame in both front legs.(n)

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Kevin McCloud watches over developments as Jeremy and Louise Brown try to convert a Grade II-listed 16th-century farmhouse in Gloucestershire that has barely been touched for more than 400 years into a luxurious modern home. They hope to reconcile the old with the new and retain the building's original historic features, including its doorways, beams and hay loft.(n)

programme.title: The Team
programme.desc: Loukauskis manages to escape the police, who immediately set up an international warrant for his arrest as they have found evidence that he raped Iris Gabler's daughter when she was 14. In a secret Skype conversation, Jean-Louis attempts to get a confession out of Loukauskis, but the billionaire has his own reasons for agreeing to take part in an interview. As Jackie and Harald try to figure out Loukauskis' whereabouts, Alicia faces her own private nightmare. Thriller, starring Lars Mikkelsen, Jasmin Gerat and Veerle Baetens. In English, German, Flemish, French and Danish.(n)

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Junior doctor Simon is concerned 40-year-old doorman Alfred, who was stabbed multiple times outside the social club where he works, may have internal injuries. Eighteen-year-old student George is brought into resus with blood coming from his ear and behaving erratically, following a fight at a party, and is sent for an urgent scan when consultant Phil becomes worried he may have a life-threatening bleed on his brain.(n)

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: The medics treat 60-year-old diabetic Tony, who has an infected leg wound and must be assessed to ensure it doesn't spread, and three-year-old Billy, who has swollen eyes after accidentally squirting detergent in them. Also treated is 80-year-old Ida, who has pain in her knee, and doctors are concerned when an x-ray reveals a shadow on her bone, which requires further tests to rule out cancer.(n)

programme.desc: Car Disaster. Two teams compete to pull practical jokes on an unsuspecting public. Prankvegas and Dancing Flamingos team up with SFX and prop-making guru Simon Tayler and stunt coordinator Abbi Collins to stage the biggest and best pranks. programme.desc: Cake Off!. The pesky pranksters this time are Pranking Pandemonium and Shining Stars. They team up with prosthetics and make-up wizard Shaune Harrison and prop maker and SFX specialist Simon Tayler to stage pranks on an unsuspecting public. The teams mock up a fancy art gallery and rig the hidden cameras and special effects required to bring the pranksters' ideas to life. But which team will impress our prank-loving panel of ranksters to win the chance to stage a prank on a target of their choice? Louis and Albie's $3,000,000 art installation Sneezing Statue takes on Thomas and Abbie's alarming Picture Breakout! programme.title: Motorway Patrol
programme.desc: Documentary following members of the New Zealand highway patrol as they witness some of the best and worst behaviour on the nation's motorways. The series is centred around the roads of Auckland, the country's largest urban area, and features motoring chaos including major traffic collisions, escaped animals and pedestrians on busy roads. programme.desc: Life in the Devon fishing port of Brixham. Elsewhere, Park prepares for her hearing with the disciplinary committee. Medical drama, starring Hugh Laurie.(n)

programme.title: Blue Bloods
programme.desc: Emotions run high for Danny when a woman he promised to help following the deaths of her parents commits suicide. Meanwhile, the Reagans suffer a devastating loss. Starring Tom Selleck, Donnie Wahlberg, Bridget Moynahan, Will Estes and Len Cariou.(n)

programme.title: Richard E Grant's Hotel Secrets
programme.desc: The actor heads to Tokyo and checks out the Park Hyatt, the hotel featured in the film Lost in Translation, and goes behind the closed doors of the Japanese capital's love hotels. In the fashionable district of Meguro, Richard takes in the Claska, which was the city's first boutique hotel and has its own canine beauty salon.(n)

programme.title: The West Wing
programme.desc: President Bartlet encounters the economist with whom he split the Nobel prize. Several youngsters try to persuade Toby they should have the right to vote, and Kate tries to iron out a border dispute with Canada. Martin Sheen and Richard Schiff star.(n)

programme.title: The West Wing
programme.desc: Josh urges Santos to implement a new strategy in a bid to reverse his fortunes as he takes his campaign to California. programme.title: Cold Case

programme.title: House
programme.desc: A man who is well-respected in his community suddenly collapses, and in the process of diagnosing his symptoms the team discovers the patient has been hiding dark and dishonest secrets about his personal and professional life. However, when the man confesses his wrongdoings to his family and community, he compromises his chances of receiving the proper medical treatment. Meanwhile, House tries to manipulate Taub into taking a DNA test to prove he is the father of two six-month-old girls. Guest starring Jamie Bamber (Law & Order: UK).(n)

programme.title: Blue Bloods

Fantasy drama, starring Emilia Clarke, Charles Dance and Jack Gleeson.(n)

programme.title: Motorway Patrol
programme.desc: Documentary following members of the New Zealand highway patrol as they witness some of the best and worst behaviour on the nation's motorways. The series is centred around the roads of Auckland, the country's largest urban area, and features motoring chaos including major traffic collisions, escaped animals and pedestrians on busy roads. There is also footage of drivers falling asleep at the wheel, overloaded vehicles and suspects caught with illegal substances - plus a host of excuses as the people pulled over try to persuade officers they have not done anything wrong.(n)
